title: Good City Hotel but disappointing staff
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Two nights in Florence
review: Good location and room decent. On arrival staff very helpful but at checkout very rude and arrogant. Image added of the man who was very unhelpful and is probably the reason i will  not go back to this hotel.

title: Great location and staff with overall decent facilities
review: Hotel with breakfast booked by travel company gate 1. Nice room and bathroom size with a choice of pillows that can be customized on arrival! Minibar and kettle with instant coffee and tea. Located between train station and Arno River so easy to avoid getting lost when first arrive. When exiting the hotel turn right to get to river walking path and will notice a laundromat and gelato place just next door.  Several elevators. Checkin and out pretty good.  Breakfast buffet wide selection of European and American selections.

title: Very good hotel
review: Thanks a lot for the excellent evaluation and for the wonderful review, It is really a pleasure for us to read your satisfaction. With the hope of being able to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, I cordially greet you.    Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Well located for City tours
review: The best thing about this hotel is it's location. It's not directly within the central area but less than a 10 minute walk which is great. A close second are the staff who were always polite and very helpful, excellent hospitality from all members be it reception members or servers at breakfast.   Following from that point the buffet breakfast is pretty decent but nothing that will wow you, good range of choice. The room itself was hygienic but like other reviewers I really struggled with the WiFi signal/speeds. The bathroom was very clean and the water pressure was great, nothing worse than a weak shower!  Overall there are definitely more modern places to stay at in Florence but if you're after a good location with brilliant staff you'd be hard pressed to find somewhere else.

title: Good value for money, good location.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: BEWARE
review: Good value for money and a good location. the hotel is very close to the main station of firenze and pretty close to the old city. like a 15-20 min walk. nice and big breakfast, not the best but good enough.

title: Very disappointed by the front desk staff
review: Many thanks for the nice words and for the good evaluation. Have a nice day.    Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Horrible hotel
review: Beware if booking this hotel on bookings.com. This hotel was allowed to access my account and mark it as "cancelled" which caused confusion, as I thought i had cancelled my reservation. Turns out, they HAD marked it as "cancelled" AND then proceeded to charge me the full price of the room and a no-show fee. I'd stay far away from this place if you value transparency, and not being fleeced. As I see it this hotel and bookings.com have basically just stolen money from me. Stay and book at own risk.

title: Beautiful stay!!
review: Dear Sirs, unfortunately doing reviews like this and hiding under a nickname is too easy, if you can give me some references on your booking I can check and understand what happened, we certainly don't charge what is not ours, it is illegal and honesty and fairness is one of our standards. It is not nice to report and hide, if you need help we are and we will always be available.    Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Good place for a first visit to Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Very Nice
review: A big advantage of this hotel is it's proximity to the train station: it's an easy walk. It did seem like there were quite a few tour groups here, but the hotel was well-placed to explore Florence. Our room overlooked an area of local apartments.The breakfast scene was a little frenzied, but the service was very good overall. There is a small bar in the hotel where you can grab some Prosecco and snacks.The restaurant seemed quiet for the evening meal (we didn't have dinner here).

title: Gate Keepers
review: Thanks a lot Sirs for the nice and detailed review and for the good evaluation, both important for us. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.     Daniele Benelli      Assistant Manager

title: A gem in florence !!
review: Not much from the outside, but once inside it is very nice. Pleasant staff who speak English. Rooms were nice with comfortable bed, but no clock. Narrow tub with shower that if not adjusted just right, floods the floor.  Controlled AC so you have to contact the front desk if you want it cooler. Tiny elevators. Limited number of electric plugs in the room. Breakfast buffet was good.

title: great breakfast
review: This hotel is old world style.  Rooms were clean, Air conditioner was controlled, so if you like it cold, this is not the place for you.  If you drive, they hold your keys hostage because there are certain times when cars are not allowed to drive.  It was inconvenient to have to ask for your keys to get something out of your car.  Other than that the hotel was ok.

title: Good central location, luxurious, bustling Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good location, good hotel
review: This hotel is situated in a very good location. We walked from the train station with our suitcases and it only took about 10 minutes along pretty, cobbled streets.  This was a hectic hotel with lots of guests and quite a noisy lobby area.  The breakfast was well supplied.  Our room was well cleaned, compact and painted bright orange.

title: A short summary of the “pluses and minuses” of our experience at this hotel
review: Our room (201) was clean and comfortable, with the added bonus of having large towels, something of a rarity in hotels nowadays. The beds were large and comfortable and a choice of pillows was available from reception if needed. Breakfasts were very busy, with people occasionally having to wait for tables but this just shows how popular the hotel is, and there was a wide selection of food available. Location is good for both the train station and restaurants, and it's not too far to walk to the Duomo, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio etc.

title: Well situated good hotel
review: Location - 5 min walk to the train station where many day tours depart. Very good restaurants close by. Considerably quiet area. Many little shops within a short walking distance.  Hotel is clean, hot breakfast is included - not great but ok. Best word to describe our impression of staff is “apathy”.  Internet (Wifi) in our room was almost non existent - one bar and sometimes two bars making it very difficult to connect or keep the connection. We were on the 6th floor and our internet connectivity issue was consistent over our two days stay.   If internet in your room is important to you, look elsewhere - otherwise, this hotel is a decent choice.

title: Great Stay
review: We have stayed here many times and always book in when we come to Florence. It has a secure lock up car park which is essential if you, like us, drive to Florence. We try and have the same room, which is large, has a desk and comfortable, if a little firm, bed. They now have a pillow menu (as we usually travel with our own). Lovely feather pillows. The bed linen is beautiful, crisp white cotton. There is a small fridge, and tea making facility. A walk-in shower, albeit slightly complicated, is ideal. The bathroom is roomy with loo, shower & bidet. Pink and blue towels which is helpful!   We loved the former breakfast room opening onto the courtyard and it’s sad we are now eating in the restaurant. I hope they change it back! Otherwise perhaps they could move the under-utilised…

title: Comfortable and airy Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Definitely not Grand
review: Nice and welcoming staff, Rooms were a good size and very comfortable with excellent air conditioning. Nice breakfasts. The location is 10 mins from the station and maybe 20 from the centre of town.  We needed a late check out and although they were helpful in organising it I was surprised how much they charged for a few hours.

title: 5 stars!
review: Thanks a lot Sirs for the nice words and the good evaluation, both important for us. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.      Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Location! Hospitable! Excellent!
review: We are on our European Vacation and have spent 2 nights at the Grand Hotel Adriatico.   Our first impression was a hotel that is desperately in need of renovations and upgrades to come up to the standards of the other hotels we have stayed in during our European vacation   Pros  Location is close to all major attractions   Air conditioning worked well during the hot days and nights   Negatives Breakfast was terrible. Burnt eggs and bacon and poor presentation of the food.   We ended up having a coffee and Danish pastry in the coffee shop next door  Bed and pillows very uncomfortable

title: NICE HOTEL, GOOD STAFF
review: Dear Sirs, thank you for leaving this comment, I am very sorry to read that you did not like our hotel. Our rooms are equipped with high quality orthopedic mattresses and if we talked to our reception we could have found a solution; in our rooms there is a pillows menu with 4 different types of pillow to choose according to your preferences. I'm really sorry for breakfast, we consider it an important moment during the stay of our customers and we always try to be very careful.  Have a nice day.     Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Overpriced with dishonest room information
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Rude Staff
review: The overpriced Grand Hotel Adriatico (GHA)….  Location: There are a dozen of excellent, better-located hotels. GHA is near the Central Station but in a scary neighbourhood.  Value: The room price was very high for its quality. I booked a Superior Queen room with a view but Superior was just my surprise – the room was small, painted in a depressing dark colour, hard beds, the TV was without picture, the bathroom was low quality (it was a real adventure to take a shower because of the clogging bathtub drain), the view was of the ruined surrounding buildings. There was no sense to inform the staff about the irregularities – the room should be constructed again.  The breakfast: Nothing special: 2-3 types of cheap bacon in the country of salami! It is free but the high prices…

title: First time-Florence
review: We recently stayed at the NOT  Grand Hotel Adriatico in Florence for 3 days.  This was our last stop on a 2 week tour of Italy/ Greece. First of all,  the front desk satff is rude, unaccommodating and dishonest.   Upon check in we were informed of a 4.80 per day room tax that must be paid at check out in euros only.  We were surpised by this information and questioned the reasoning since we had limited euros and planned to put incidentals on our credit card.  The Front Desk receptionist insisted.  We later found out that she was in fact lying to us and we could use our credit card. This was ony the begining of the deception.  I booked a superior room with the romantic package which should have included a view, champange, breakfast in room and chocolates. We received none.  I was…

title: I’d give it 10 stars
review: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.  The location was perfect, so we could walk to most of the interesting sites.  We enjoyed breakfast every day; it was delicious.  The fresh fruit was very tasty.  The shopping, restaurants and walking tour we took were wonderful.  Going out on our own around the city was super fun.  The David and Duomo were very interesting.  Our guide was very informative and gave us interesting highlights.  She also suggested some restaurants and shopping areas which was so helpful.  The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful.  Our room was clean and had nice amenities.

title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
review: Thank you very much Mrs Elizabeth for this wonderful review and for the excellent evaluation, both very important, reading your satisfaction is a source of pride for us. With the hope of being able to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, I cordially greet you.   Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Nice hidden surprise
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Very clean and tidy.
review: The inside of the hotel is such a nice site as compared to outside and it’s surroundings.  Room snacks, fruit and drinks are complimentary but they don’t tell you unless you call.  That is the only downside. Breakfast is awesome and staff is very nice.  Jane at the front desk is the best.  Definitely would stay here again.

title: excelent
review: Thanks alot Sirs for the nice words and the good evaluation, both important for us. We are very pleased to read your satisfaction, I showed our receptionist Jane what you wrote and she was very pleased. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli       Assistant Manager

title: Great get-away  Secret
review: We chose this hotel on a long weekend break. It is located within the old city of Firenze, but close enough to walk everywhere. It’s literally 10 minutes from Firenze SMN railway station. If you see pictures of the outside PLEASE, do not let this put you off. The inside is totally different. It is well presented, very tidy and clean and the staff are pleasant and helpful. This hotel is privately owned and I think this shows in how it is kept. The comfort room that we booked was exactly that. Not massive, but on a long weekend you don’t spend that much time in the room. It had everything you require, TV, Fridge/Mini Bar, hair dryer, trouser press, toiletries, comfortable bed.  The breakfast selection was exceptional and good quality. I would certainly return to this hotel. Give…

title: A Taste Of Florence
review: Thanks a lot for this detailed review, for the nice words and for the good evaluation, it's important for us to read your satisfaction. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.      Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Ah Firenze
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice hotel in a special good location
review: We were here for a short holiday of only 3 days to see the end of the Leonardo Notebook exhibit at the Uffizi. It ended up being an excellent location, not far from the main train station. The room was very well appointed and rather spacious. I found the bed very comfortable and slept well. Breakfast was included in our stay; it was good and filling, but not very creative.  The staff was courteous and helpful. I found it was easy walking to most of the places we wished to see. There  are lot of dining options nearby and some interesting shopping. The Basilica Santa Maria Novella is also very close and worth as visit.  I think that what made the stay so enjoyable was just the city, which is amazing.

title: I do not recommend the hotel.
review: A quite clean hotel room with a safe, coffee-tea maker, 2 small bottles of water only at the 1st  (checκ in) day,  ironing board, hairdryer, 3 towels /p.p.  in the clean bathroom with limited variety of toiletries. No bathrobe, no slippers, not enough cloth hangers. Comfy bed mattress, not so hard, not so soft.  They gave us a no view, back side room (501), but we didn’t mind, as we were out, the most of the day.  Breakfast was not something special, had the basic and so usual kind of food. In the country of the best prosciutto and cheese, they had a completely tasteless cheese (just one kind) and omelette, and limited variety of bread and ham. Reception and breakfast room staff, was exceptional kind and quick. Great location, just 4’-5’ walk to the Santa Maria Novella train…

title: Excellent hotel....great position... short walk to train station!
review: Sole reason that I would recommend Grand Hotel Adriatico is that I did not discover that I was missing anything until I came back home to the states. I had brought over $400 in cash, in case we needed to exchange it while in Florence. I had left the money in my laptop bag on a high shelf under a blanket in the wardrobe. A member of the staff thought it was okay to go through our things and take all the money that I had. I doubt that I will get the $400+ back. I would not recommend staying at this unless you take everything you bring with you to Florence with you each day.   I have received a message from the General Manager, Chiara Caridi of a review that I had posted on their Facebook page, that I was lying. She was trying to minimize the situation. We had talked to one of…

title: Great location for seeing the city
review: We booked a package to stay three nights at this hotel (with our friends also) at a very reasonable price. On arrival we were checked in by a nice lady at reception. Our room was lovely…..large bed with soft sheets, bathrobes and slippers provided too.  There was a safe and tea and coffee making facilities and also a mini bar. The bathroom had plenty of toiletries and six towels...bath and shower. The chambermaids did a wonderful job every day….clean towels, sheets and left  our room very clean each day. The breakfast was brilliant ...plenty  of choice …...many pastries, cakes, eggs, ham cheeses etc….salads, fruit and yogurts  as well as some  cooked items. Plenty of water, juices  and tea or  coffees. Only five minutes walk from the train station...as we had flown to Pisa. …

title: Nice hotel near the Florence SM Novella Train Station
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Nice location
review: Great hotel.  Definitely an upgrade from Hotel Centauro in Venice.  Beds were nice and firm.  Room has a safe.  It's got bathtubs.  And very quiet.  I start to wonder if hotels in the US are built incorrectly since even staying in luxury Vegas hotel, I can hear people talking as they walk past the door where as not even a peep in Italy.   Breakfast starts at 6:30.  You have to ask waitstaff for coffee.  Everything else is self service.  There are couple elevators.  The front desk may have bus ticket for purchase which comes in handy when going to Michelangelo Square.  Nearby - Conad market which is much cheaper than mini mart and convenient stores.  You can also buy bus tickets here.  Trattoria Dall'Oste for Florence Steak.  Try Catalina for dessert.  There's small street food…

title: Great hotel in a good location
review: This hotel was near to the main train station, took about 5 minutes walk to this hotel. It was also not very far from the other city attractions. The room and bathroom  were spacious. The staffs are friendly.  Breakfast spread was good.  An enjoyable stay

title: Good location
review: Only 10 minutes walk from the station and easy walking distance from the main sights this is a great hotel for sightseeing.  The room was clean and well equipped - I loved the monogrammed towels with a bath towels big enough to wrap around me.  The breakfast buffet was good but a little unvarying.   The staff were encountered were friendly and helpful.  There are some good small restaurants nearby.

title: Good Hotel for a Florence visit.
review: We stayed three nights in October.  The room was a typical size.  It had a window that opened but no balcony.  It seemed to be in a residential area. There were a number of restaurants including Asian and Indian cuisine.  The breakfast was a nice selection of foods.  It was about a 15 minute walk to the cathedral.

title: A hotel worth noting
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Good hotel with easy access to Florence
review: We were traveling with a study group and stayed at Grand Hotel Adriatico for 6 nights.   Our room was clean, fresh, and ready for new guests even though we arrived quite early and had expected to have to leave our bags. With a short wait (15 minutes max) and we were given our keys.  Since we are friends traveling together,  we requested twin beds; they were close together but definitely separate. The beds were firm and very comfortable.   The shower was much better than I expected, and the towels were seriously great. If I had one comment about the bathroom, it would be to recommend they leave a second roll of toilet tissue. We had to call down for one to be brought up.   The breakfast buffet was quite good, lots to choose from, and attentive wait staff. There were hot and cold…

title: Holiday
review: This is a nice hotel which is centrally located to Florence. The walk to the Duomo took about 15 minutes. There are plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. The room was clean, comfortable and lotw of hot water. The wi-fi was sufficiently fast. The only downside for me was that the breakfast room was quite small and could get really busy, when the hotel is full. They did a good job of putting people onto tables but there were large queues for the buffet. The parking is 25 euros per night, which seems ot be standard in Italy. I got a good deal so I would stay there again.

title: Great hotel, Great location.
review: Stayed in this 4* beautiful hotel last weekend.The hotel is situated just about a five minute walk from the train/bus station and approx 15 mins from the historical centre of town. Good location. Attractive foyer entrance and reception area.Our room had ample toiletries, towels etc. Good buffet selection including Gluten Free foods for breakfast.Staff were very friendly and helpful. On my return list 😁 KK

title: Home away from home
review: Great hotel centrally located, this hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the main train station. The rooms are off a good size well decorated with lovely bathroom very clean. The location of the hotel makes it easy to walk to the centre of Florence and all its attractions. Breakfast at the hotel has a great selection and all the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly . Great hotel for long or short staff perfect.

title: Great location, staff, clean
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great place as a base to visit the city
review: We stayed here in 2008 and while the staff has changed, it is very welcoming and helpful. Unfortunately I lost my prescription sunglasses while there, not to be found, but the staff did everything to help me locate them. They called taxis which showed up on time. Our room was quiet and clean, the bathrooms were updated. The breakfast was ample, the dining room was pleasant.

title: Very good hotel
review: The hotel is situated in a side street between the river and the old city centre - just a few minutes walk from restaurants, shops and tourist attractions.  Don't be put off by the outside, the inside is much better.  Reception staff were helpful, parking on-site and secure, bedroom large with loads of storage.  The air-con wasn't that great.  Breakfast was ok - fair amount of choice.  Would highly recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay  in a convenient location.

title: Home away from home
review: Thanks a lot Mr Nicola for this nice and complete review and for the good valuation, both important for us. It's really a good thing for us to read your satisfaction about our hotel, our services and our staff. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: The perfect choice
review: We enjoyed this hotel for the two nights we had in Florence.  The staff on reception were very welcoming and friendly.  The room was clean and comfortable and the hotel is well located, quite close to the train station and easy walking to the city centre and restaurants. The breakfast was enjoyable.

title: Nice hotel.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Wonderfull city, Bad hotel policy
review: This hotel was one of them any  that we stayed in with our tour. It had a good location and friendly staff. Hotel itself was a little worn with all the tour groups  going through it , but the breakfast was good and was very clean. I enjoyed my stay.

title: Beautiful hotel in good location
review: Thanks for the nice words and the good valuation. Have a nice day Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Excellent location, room, service
review: The city is wonderfull, full of history. The cathedralls are amazing. Everywhere you go you breath history, art, culture. These are the good things The bad thing is.the policy of some of the hotels: Grand Hotel Adriatico has this bad policy: after you finish the vacation and you spend all your money , they ask a tax about 4.5 euro/person/day for the city. It is not a problem that they ask for it, it is a problem that they ask at the end of the vacation when you already spend all your money. And if you don't pay, they call carabinieri. This is not normal !

title: Good hotel, but a disaster restaurant
review: Thanks alot Ms Manuela for thsi review and for the nice words, the TOURSIT TAX or CITY STAY TAX is not required by our hotel but is a tax on tourists imposed by the City of Florence and varies depending on the hotel's stars; in our case, being a 4-star hotel the fee is Euro 4.80 per person, per night. At the time of booking, with any portal or agency being made there is always written an information on this tax that varies in amount according to the city visited. Even in our hotel, within the lifts there are signs with explanations and information on the tourist tax, colleagues at the reception always explain it to all customers and in the directories in our rooms we talk about the tourist tax.  With the hope that this explanation was exhaustive, I cordially greet you. Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Affordable and convenient
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good Hotel
review: The hotel is located about a 5-10 minute walk from the Santa Novella station and it's accompanying bus and tram stops. It's location is very convenient and makes it easy to access all of the attractions without being too far away from the station.  The hotel itself is lovely - the lobby is well decorated and light with plenty of space to sit and relax. Check-in was very quick and easy with the staff very professional and polite. Our room was great - very strong AC, comfortable bed and well-stocked minibar.  Breakfast was good too - a selection of continental classics and a small range of hot food - bacon, sausages, eggs etc.  All in all a pleasant experience which offers very good value for money for it's location.

title: Everything you want for city break

title: Lovely hotel with friendly staff in excellent location
review: Only a short walk from Santa Maria Novella train station, this hotel makes an excellent choice.   Clean and comfortable with breakfast included.  I agree with other recent reviews that the air con was first class and the linen very good.  Don’t be put off with what appears to be the outside as the walkway past the water wall to reception is the way in.  They have a restaurant which is discounted for guests. We ate out and at the hotel .  Staff very helpful.  Would certainly stay there again as in easy reach of most attractions.

title: Nice Hotel in an area not safe feeling
review: Have to say do not expect high value. The breakfast are minimum,  the service are far away from good. The prices compare to value are far away.   I was here 3 night 2 room connect with my 2 child..believe me with the prices I pay better to find real 4 star

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed 2 nights in August 2018. Good location for exploring centre of florence.  We were supposed to be in superior room it was ok not overly large but had everything we needed. Seemed popular with American and Japanese tourists. Breakfast had something for everyone and all staff as always in Italy were first class, one of the reasons we keep exploring more of the beautiful country.  Would recommend if you get it for right price. We didnt have a room with a view. Free wifi

title: Lovely Hotel, Perfectly Located for Drivers
review: The location is only 5 minutes from railway station. The room was a generous size and bed was comfortable. The breakfast staff were very good but the breakfast was unchanged during our 5 night stay. Internet service provided was poor and we had problems connecting to it on regular occasions. On our last night the aircon began to leak out of a light fitting to such an extent it soaked several towels around 5am. After ringing reception I was assured somebody would be there at 6am to fix the problem. At 7am with the aircon still leaking I reported the problem in person to reception and 10 minutes later a repairman arrived at the door with a ladder, a rag, a hose and a 15 litre bucket. He left 5 minutes later he left job done and a full bucket of water.

title: Central location
review: We chose the hotel as it has a car park (a little expensive at €20 per day), however, perfectly placed immediately outside the city zone charge area. The Hotel is modern, with smart public areas and comfortable rooms and beds. We had standard rooms with balconies overlooking the car park, but still great to sit on at the end of a hot day sightseeing.  The breakfast had a good selection with hot and cold choices. The staff were courteous and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights there and would definitely use the hotel again if re-visiting Florence.

title: Excellent stay
review: The Adriatico is a good location for both the Train Station and for sightseeing, 10 mins walk from the Duomo. Staff at the Hotel are very friendly and helpful, rooms are very clean and spacious, Car parking is available but limited. Recommended for a short stay in Florence.

title: Hotel Transylvania
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Grand Hotel Adriatico
review: A “authentic” venue just around the corner from a dirty Kebab shop and a disco tech filled to the brim with 12 year olds - everything you expect from a night in the beautiful Florence.  We were welcomed with an abrupt “where’s your passport and credit cards” and when asked for the bar we got pointed in the direction of the scullery.  The interior design of the ruin/hotel resembled something of a bygone era and reminded me of a medieval brothel.  Lastly the room, with a beautiful view of Florence couldn’t be enjoyed as the window (on the top floor) doesn’t open more then 2cm.   Other then that, a brilliant experience in all ;)

title: A great hotel!
review: This seems to be a nice hotel until things start going wrong. Many of the people in our tour group experienced annoying inconveniences such as flooding showers, non-functioning TVs, and an unpleasant smell in the bathrooms.  While most of the staff simply placated us with a smile, the manager was extremely condescending and dismissive. The only gracious staff member was the attentive hostess at the breakfast buffet.

title: Definitely recommend this Hotel
review: We stayed at Grand Hotel Adriatico from 21-24 Jun 2018. They upgraded us to a suite and I must say that the master bedroom was huge with a smaller kids room. The bath too was spacious and well equipped. The staff were very courteous and helpful, a big change from our experience in Rome! The rooms were cleaned on time and the overall ambience was excellent. The breakfast was sumptuous with enough options, I suggest that scrambled eggs and potato wedges be added to the menu to make it more complete. Other than the service and facilities, the USP of this hotel is its location. It is walking distance from the railway station and all the key areas to visit. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Robery
review: Dear Sirs, Many thanks for your kind and detailed review, it's really a pleasure for us read that you enjoied your stay at our hotel. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Nice stay
review: I stayed at Grand Hotel Adriatico only for one night but I immediately noticed the high level of the staff behavior and the nice restyling of the rooms they recently had. Hotel is very clean, located very close to the city center. Nearby there’s plenty of shops and restaurants you may need. Breakfast is rich and delicious. Rooms at the 6th floor have a beautiful view. I recommend this hotel, a fully deserved 4 star place in the heart of Florence!

title: Fairly good location Decent hotel
review: I stayed in the hotel for three nights. I had a very enjoyable stay. Besides the fact that hotel is not located in a very nice location, everything else is just very nice. It is placed a phew minutes far from central station. I got a nice big room with comfortable for sleeping bed and well working WiFi. Room was cleaned daily. Staff was friendly and always ready to help. I enjoyed very much breakfast in the hotel with many tasty dishes. Hotel itself is looking very nice and very modern. If I would go to Florence again Grand Hotel Adriatico can be an option for me.

title: Great value for money in Florence...!
review: our room was on the 7th floor, a little different because there were only two rooms on that floor.  The room was decent size, and bed comfortable. Overall nice and staff were nice.  I think it was a good value, because everything was within walking distance, everything we wanted to see was within a mile of the hotel.

title: Bed Bugs!
review: Good place with clean building. title: Very High Quality
review: While booking this hotel it looked nice, excellent location  wonderful pictures. On arriving it was not the exact situation. The location is about 650 meters from the central station. But the way to the hotel is through narrow passageways not so easy when somebody is with a heavy suitcase.  many foreign workers and tiny  workshops and grocery shops.  My room was on the 3 floor with a window the back of the street  which looked more like a  slum. Inside it was well equipped but painted with very dark red/brown color which I did not like. From the hotel to the old city or to the main toured roads the distance is not so far/ About 15-20 minutes walk. The stuff at the reception was very helpful and polite.   There was noise especially at the evening hours from the outside. All and…

title: Better than we expected- GREAT STAY!
review: I have waiting for a while to write this review after leaving this hotel in Florence. I booked this hotel after checking reviews. I thought it was convenient because the hotel was close to train station.  We were told by friends that to be careful about thieves before travelling to Italy. We visited other cities in Italy without any issue till visiting Florence and staying in this hotel. Right after checking in the first night and next day morning all of our cash was stolen next day morning while out for breakfast. This was really shock for us, we travelled a lot in US, Europe and Asia w/o such experience that thieves were so easy to get into your rooms and searching. This hotel had no surveillance to know who went into our room. We reported it to the front desk when we found…

title: Great hotel in a great location
review: We were delighted with this hotel - the fittings and trimmings of a five star hotel! Staff were friendly, breakfast was great, location really nice and good to have some English TV channels. We had a paid for a room to fit a family of four - booking.com said it would have a double bed and a single bed and we could ask for a cot… our expectations were exceeded when we opened our door to find a corridor, two bedrooms (one with two singles and a cot and one with the a queen bed), a huge bathroom with double sinks and a bath with spa jets and shower jets and also another luggage and dressing room off the main room. It was perfect for our family and very luxurious. I loved the bath salts as part of the toiletries! There was no view from the room. The wifi was quite fast and we loved…

title: Another excellent stay.
review: Thanks a lot for this wonderful review and for all the nice words. it's really a pleasure for us to read your satisfaction and we are proud about it. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Welcoming hotel in a great location
review: This hotel is 5 minutes form the main train and bus station. It is also a 15 minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio. The double room we had on the 6th floor was a decent size and the included  breakfast was good. I would go back to this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. This is a very good 4 star hotel which does not cost the earth. N ext door there is a small supermarket which sells beer, water and snacks.

The bed linen and towels were of excellent quality and refreshed daily.  We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel and couldn't fault it at all.

title: Great Location...
review: Our room, on the fourth floor, was just what we needed at the end of a day exploring the city.  The bed was comfortable, although the pillows a little harder than we like!  The room was always cleaned to a very high standard, as was the rest of the hotel.  The only down side was the price of drinks in the bar. On the two nights we went we were the only people there which is not surprising. The hotel is well located for exploring the city. Do use the bus service from the airport, the bus station is a 5 minute walk away and great value at 6 euros.  We paid for a return taxi but unfortunately the return did not give us a pick up time despite several phone calls. Ask at the desk for the best places to eat, great advice at a very reasonable price.

title: Great hotel
review: Firstly this hotel gets 5/5 for customer service . I was unable to travel last Nov and mr Daniele the assistant manager ensured we could change booking within set time . So thumbs up there. Reception lady was awesome and generally other staff very pleasant . Now to room issues faced ... Clean and tidy , looks updated , central to SMN station and eateries . Slightly unsavoury area but had no issues . My only issue is my husband and I have broken out in rash and bites which we believe from bedding so haven’t not slept in two nights here as itching a lot . Room been little nippy and heating on Breakfast is not the best with tinned fruit ,  Poor hot selection , bacon so over cooked the pig itself wud cry to know it sacrificed it’s like in VAIN . one toaster so with big party of…

title: Great hotel, location and price!
review: Stayed here for new year. Had a superior room very spacious. The maid service excellent. Room cleanliness second to none. Breakfast choice was wide from pancakes to bacon to fresh fruit. Hotel easily assessable for all the major attraction.  Would stay again

title: Up to expectations
review: Very clean and comfortable hotel. We had three people in a triple room which was divided and almost as large as two rooms. One bed was in the foyer area and then the twins were in the large area of the room. We had plenty of space for all of us and our three large suitcases. Free breakfast. Free WiFi. Fantastic location close to the train station and a ten minute walk from major sites. Friendly staff. Would encourage others to stay here during a visit to Florence.

title: Nice Hotel, Great Location!
review: We stayed in this hotel mid November 2017.  I recommend, but remember this is not a 5 star hotel, however a very fare 4 stars.  Room very clean, comfortable and not small.  Employees were very pleasant and all spoke English.  Our rate included breakfast and very good, with pastries, fruits, eggs, etc.  Close to train station (walking distance), no need to get a taxi.  Not far from the attractions.  We stayed 2 nights in this hotel and it is a very nice and confortable place to be.

review: From this hotel you can walk to many areas but the neighborhood seemed a little seedy and would never go back to this hotel.  Breakfast was average and rooms were small but decent. Good size bathroom and service.

title: Average
review: Thanks for this review, we will take care about your suggestions. Have a nice day. Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Breakfast shocker
review: We stayed here for 3 nights for around 360 euros, so you would think that it was around 120 euros per night, but that would be inaccurate. When we checked out the bill read three different rates with the lowest at 107 euros, but totalling the 360 we paid. We asked about staying another night and were quoted 275 euros and when I was clearly shocked, the lady offered to lower it to 255 euros.  Out of curiosity, I checked with Booking.com for that night and found the advertised rate was 192 euros.  Nothing illegal, but not sure about the ethics.  Just be aware.  Otherwise, it was a very pleasant stay with best breakfast we had in all of Italy.

review: We enjoyed this place for two nigth. Very nice hotel close to center Staff very friendly .4 star   recommendable. Walking distance to the centre. Clean en profesional. Little secured parking, but we were lucky!!. We can recoment this place.

title: Decent hotel in a great location
review: It's really a pleasure for us to read your review and we thank you very much; we try to do our best to meet the needs of all our customers and when we do that we are very proud. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Comfortable and spacious rooms
review: フィレンツェ駅から徒歩5分ほど、大きなスーツケースがあっても十分歩ける距離です。9月5日から３泊しましたが、部屋は毎日きれいに清掃されていて、タオルが３枚用意されており、バスタブがあり湯量も十分、快適に過ごせました。朝ごはん時には、コーヒー等のサービスがあります。コストパフォーマンスは高いです。  近隣にはカフェ、レストラン、ミニスーパーもあります。ホテルの2軒隣にコインランドリーがあり洗濯できたことも長旅には便利でした。  フロントのコンシェルジュがとても親切でホスピタリティーが高く、結婚式と新婚旅行を兼ねていた旅行に良い思い出を作ってくれました。次回もまた泊まりたいホテルです。  Stayed for 3 days at this hotel in Sep 2017.We stayed in 130 room that was always clean and very comfortable.   We were very happy with this hotel’s surprise. We will never forget ,because It really means a lot to our new life.  We highly recommend the hotel and will stay here again,definitely.

title: Short stay but great
review: Many thanks for your kind and detailed review, it's really a pleasure for us read that you enjoied your stay at our hotel. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Decent hotel with very friendly helpful staff
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Comfortable and good location
review: Good location, slightly further away from the centre but only 10 min walk and probably a good thing after an evening meal and very convenient for the train station. Entrance doesn't show off the hotel and my wife didn't like the cheap plastic plants! Breakfast outside on the patio  was very pleasant although gluten free options were limited. Reception and serving staff were very friendly, rooms clean and spacious.

title: Lovely!
review: Thanks a lot for this beautiful review and thanks for sharing it with this website; it's a good thing for us to know that you appreciated our hotel and all our services. makes us understand that we are going in the right direction for customer satisfaction. We hope to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept all our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Excellent hotel, run down location
review: We had a comfortable stay for 3 nights at the Grand Hotel Adriatico in August.  It is close to the train station and many of the sites in the city.  The room was a good size, clean and the bed was comfortable but the pillows were horrible and flat.  I don't understand this whole "pillow menu" baloney.  Why should I have to call to ask for decent pillows?  The breakfast was...meh.  But we didn't go there for their breakfast buffet.  The only real drawback was the guest in the room next to ours who smoked in the room (with the door open) - even though it was a non-smoking room.  The smell permeated the hallway and wafted into our room and it was disgusting.

title: Close to city
review: Thanks Ms Sharon for this review; It is true that we have the "pillows menu" in our hotel just to try to meet the needs of all our customers, we can not put 4 different pillows in each room, it is much simpler with the "pillows menu" .. ...Concerning the smell of smoking coming from the room next to your (which was a no smoking room) you had to inform us at the front desk and we had the possibility to do something for you. Have a nice day. Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Comfortable hotel close to city
review: Myself and my mother stayed at the Grand Hotel Adriatico for 4 nights.  It was a really relaxing stay. The hotel has an art deco feel and I really liked the interior, I felt it fitted in perfectly with the surrounding area.  Good breakfast selection in the morning, you could sit outside in the garden too if you wanted.  Rooms were a good size with brilliant air con (which was very much needed in the 40c heat!)  I would recommend this hotel as it is a very short walk to all major sights and a very comfortable hotel.

title: Great Location
review: Many thanks for your kind and detailed review, it's really a pleasure for us read that you enjoied your stay at our hotel. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Comfortable hotel with the perfect location!
review: Hotel is comfortable distance to most of the attractions of Florence,  a 20 min walk can get you to most places. Great  garden area for breakfast. Staff helpful and speak good English. Standard 4 star hotel.

title: Perfect Staff

title: Average hotel
review: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during June 2017.This has been our 4 or 5 visit to this hotel. The hotel has been beautifully renovated including a very efficient airconditioning system which is very important at this time of the year in Florence. The room was well equipped, breakfast was plenty and delicious. Staff very friendly and helpful. We arrived by car and the hotel has a parking lot  which is very convenient. All the important sights are within convenient walking distance from the hotel.. Highly recommended.

title: Very pleasant experience
review: Dear Rachel,  thank you very much for this nice words about our hotel.  I hope to welcome back here again soon.  Kind regards

title: Very well located,  clean and friendly hotel.
review: Its a basic hotel...slightly tacky. Room was clean and good enough for a 2 day stay.  Breakfast was a big disappointment...very packaged, not very fresh spread...even bread in a place like Florence wasn't good.  Location is quite good and walking distance from most imp spots.

title: It's alright.
review: Dear Mrs Anitdeshpande,  thank you very much for writing us a review.  I'm very sorry that you did not like our breakfast offer. Of course, due to your suggestion, I'm going to check personally what has to be improved right now in order to give a better service.  I remain at your disposal for any further suggestion.   I hope to welcome you back here to check our improvements.  Kind regards

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: Good hotel amenities, staff throughout hotel charming and helpful.  I would particularly recommend the disabled rooms as other hotels we stayed in in Italy claimed disabled facilities which were not satisfactory.  This hotel had no steps at the entrance,  a large lift to take a wheelchair and good bathroom facilities for those with limited mobility. Staff were quick to move chairs in the breakfast room to make space and the buffet was easy to access.

title: OK, nothing more
review: Dear Susan M,  thank you for your nice review about our hotel.  I am very happy to hear that you liked the disabled rooms in all its facilities. It is very important to us because to know that we are moving to the right direction.  I hope to welcome you here again.  Kind regards

title: Great hotel and location.
review: We stayed at the hotel 6 nights. In the middle of a so so(but safe) neighborhood 5 minutes from the central train station (and central bus station) is a proper 4 star hotel.  Large, very clean, excellent breakfast, good air conditioning,excellent attentive staff. Wonderful green leafy inner courtyard where you can eat breakfast. In a 10-12 minute walking radius there are dozens of excellent restaurants, the Arno is just down the street and the bus lines that crisscross Old Florence are right near by. Laundromats and supermarkets right near by. Every night we were spoiled for choice of where to eat. The beds were a little hard for me personally - my husband was fine with them.  I solved the problem by placing 2 summer quilts on my side of the bed under the sheet and I slept well…

title: Florence Vacation 4th - 11th June 2017

title: Excellent hotel in good location near train station
review: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend with my mom. We took the train from Rome to Florence and the hotel was walking distance which was super nice. The staff was helpful in booking tours and recommending restaurants. The bar was great with a large selection of cocktails and snacks.  The rooms were very clean, air conditioned and lots of character. Breakfast is included and they have outside patio seating. My mom used the fitness center and it's pretty simple but still functional. Overall a great hotel and would highly suggest to those traveling who want to be close to the river, shopping, and attractions.

title: Excellent Central Hotel
review: Many thanks for your kind and detailed review, it's really a pleasure for us read that you enjoied your stay at our hotel. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Nice
review: Location was great for all walking to all sights in Florence.  Longest walk was to Santa Croce Church (20 minutes).  Excellent breakfast with option to eat outside.  Friendly, helpful staff.  Room has an outdoor balcony with table and chairs.  Don't think many of the room had this.   Laundry next door.

title: Nice hotel, convenient to train station
review: less than a 10-min walk from the train station and you can eaily walk to most of the historical sites in less than half-an-hour.  breakfast is included - excellent variety and the dining room staff is ultra-attentive.  Front desk staff is helpful .... but could be a bit friendlier... but this seems to be fairly common in northern Italy.  Great little sandwich shop next to the hotel main entrance.. try his buffalo cheese and eggplant sandwiches.  Hotel beds are ultra-hard, but if you get a few extra pillows, you can sleep on them and be fairly comfortable.

title: Great hotel!
review: Thanks a lot for posting this review which is really important for us; It helps us to understand the feelings and impressions of our clients during their stay. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Nice, modern hotel only a couple of blocks from the train station.  Easy walk to  & along the river to the Ponte Vecchia, Ufizzi, & Galileo Museum. From thence up the street to the Duomo, Giotto's Belltower, & the Accademia. Our triple was quiet roomy, quiet, and private, with the double and twin beds in separate rooms.  The view from the windows of the terracotta tile rooftops of the neighborhood was charming. Breakfast was an expansive variety of rolls, rusks, cheese, ham, yoghurt, eggs, cereal, tomatoes, juices, and even ramen noodles.  Staff was helpful, pleasant & readily answered all our questions. Late afternoon checkout is available for 15 euros, but we were able to leave our bags with the desk & tour until our train left.

title: A great place to stay in Florence
review: Many thanks for this wonderful review which is really important for us and many thanks for the very nice words. It is very important for us to hear the impressions of our clients and when we meet them we are proud of it. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: A very comfortable central hotel
review: The hotel is close to most attractions in Florence and just a five-minute walk from SM Novella train station. The Front desk staff is professional, but they could be a little more friendly! The breakfast is good, and the staff was attentive. Every time we took a shower, there was a flood inside the bathroom due to the weak solution (and also due to poor maintenance) to keep the water inside the bathtub. By the way, we ended up with the shower flux control lever in our hands sometimes!! Despite the temperatures outside, the rooms were hot at the end of the days. The management's decision to turn off the room temperature controls was very weird, as it gave no choice to the guests, except open the windows, as we did it sometimes. In fact, we had never seen such a thing. We stayed…

title: Great location in the heart of Florence
review: A very welcome bottle of chilled sparkling wine and chocolates were brought to our room as soon as we arrived.   Our room on the 5th floor was comfortable and quiet.   The hotel is well located being about 7 minutes walk from Santa Maria Novella station and close to the Arno and within walking distance of the most of the main sights.

title: Friendly staff and Clean hotel!
review: It's really a pleasure for us to read your review and we thank you very much; we try to do our best to meet the needs of all our customers and when we do that we are very proud. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Good location
review: A very nice hotel for Florence.  The staff was great.  Very helpful and friendly.  I was riding a motorcycle across Italy and they arranged for secure parking on short notice.  The lobby of the hotel is beautiful, the rooms have updated fixtures and were very clean. My only complaints were, as mentioned in another review, the shower is not well designed, it leaked pretty badly.  And that my single room was remarkably small, with a single bed.  I would suggest if you stay here, to book a larger room.  The hotel is walking distance to everything, so it didn't matter that much to me.

title: Very fair.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Uncomfortably small room
review: The staff for the most part was exceptional and VERY service oriented expectantly at breakfast. However, the hotel its self is NOT nice. Upon checking in I found someones dental floss on the floor of the bathroom in my room. The hotel could have been cleaner. Furthermore, the bathrooms are funky. The showers are not contained and the water goes all over the bathroom when you shower - it's impossible to prevent. The rooms are small and nothing is luxurious.  I couldn't get proper air conditioning or fresh air in the room.

title: Very clean,  convenient and comfortable!
review: My husband and I recently spent four nights here and we were surprised at how small the room was. First locatiowise it was easy to get to from the main train station, just a short walk. There were little convenient shops located nearby and walking to the main attractions like the Uffizi and Palazzo Pitti was quite easy. The room we had was rather small; a double bed in the middle with just enough walkway on the sides. There was a safe and bathroom was okay. No jug to boil water and I think only two bottles of water were provided for the days that we were there. Note, not two bottles per day but two bottles per stay! And with no jug to boil water, we had to buy big bottles of water. No central aircon and when we asked at the reception we were told that this is the city regulation…

title: Nice and friendly hotel in the heart of Florence!
review: Many thanks for this review which is important for us; I'm sorry you found our rooms small but just to inform you, our classic double rooms have a minimum area of 19 square meters, larger than the size required by our regional laws; However, you could ask our reception if there were any larger rooms available and we would do our best to accommodate you. With our best regards. Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Lovely hotel and excellent value
review: Cannot find fault really. The hotel is close to the railway station and not many minutes to the river in the other direction.  Room was scrupulously clean and well appointed. Toiletries provided, plus a hairdryer in the bathroom. Towels and bed linen beautifully fresh.   Wifi worked very well.   Room was quiet and peaceful. Lifts available... pleasant and helpful staff.   Breakfast was definitely adequate but the coffee could be better...  A good choice overall. Would stay there again.

title: Excellent hotel
review: This hotel was convenient for the station and town centre. It is 10 minutes from the station and 20 minutes to the Duomo or Plaza del Signoria- so handy for the main sights. It was also good for a meeting at the Fortessa which was a 15-20 minute walk away. The room was adequate with a good free wifi. Breakfast was continental with pre-cooked scrambled eggs (not great) but a good selection of cold meats, bread. The staff were overworked so catching their eye to get tea/coffee was difficult, which was the only negative point of the stay.

title: Excellent hotel!
review: Very convenient location near Santa Maria Novella. Big room, nice decoration, wifi working well. No noise (room on a little garden). Breakfast very good. People very nice, reception or breakfast. Very good price.

The breakfast was amazing and the staff were helpful. It has a great location and is clean and tidy. Thank yo for making our stay fantastic.

title: Convenient and Comfortable
review: Booked the hotel through a hotel provider called Hoojoozat the room was explained correctly from ththe site and the price 72 Euro per night, with breakfast...I think it worth every penny. Hotel is located few meters from the main train station and from the Duomo and from the conference palace where there was a fair. The Hotel is just in the middle of Florence, modern nice hotel with big rooms and good wifi , only issue was that the safe was not working in total a wonderful hotel

title: Attention to detail
review: Clean rooms, beautifully decorated and decent breakfast are some of the striking features of this hotel.But the one feature which stands out is its location. Adriatico is very well located near to all major sightseeing areas. It is a 5 min walk from the station yet is peaceful.it is a very beautiful hotel we were there for Xmas and it was well decorated. A kettle in the room would be very helpful and if the breakfast could have some variations, since it appears the same all days.  Overall a great experience and would definitely stay again.

review: It is in a very good location close to the Railway terminal. It is well maintained and clean. The service is very good. The mattress and pillows are comfortable. The continental breakfast was not good  but if you are from North America you might want to eat out anyways as the Italian hotel breakfast in general is not good.

title: Clean some walking distance from main square
review: Many thanks for this nice review, it's a pleasure for us to read our Client's satisfaction. Hoping to welcome yu again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept all our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Lovely Hotel
review: We (2 adults & 2 children aged 13&15) stayed here in July 2016. Fantastic place, great service, very helpful with directions etc and told us where to eat etc. Room, Bathroom etc. all top notch. Fantastic Location literally a few minutes’ walk to the Train Station. Highly recommend this place for local and price if you’re looking for good clean accommodation with a bit of class. Thanks again!!!

title: Location and Comfort
review: My wife got sick with strep throat while we were here and we had to call for a doctor.  The front desk staff was very helpful in arranging for a doctor to come almost immediately to our room where the doctor evaluated my wife's condition and prescribed some medications.  After, I journeyed to the pharmacy across the street and to the one at the rail station not too far from the first pharmacy.  Unfortunately, I got lost....and 2 hours later, I found my way back to my hotel where my wife was burning up with a 104 degree temperature.  Lesson learned: always have the name of your hotel with you.

title: Just ok for me
review: Many thanks for your kind review, we are really glad when our Clients had a good time at our Hotel and appreciate all our services. We hope to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico.  With best regards Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Nice and pleasant
review: WE stayed 3 nights and loved everything about this hotel. Parking at the door. Very clean and serviced daily. Breakfast was fresh with huge selection,pleasant service and long hours. Nice sheets and a pick your pillow option! Big tub and thick towels. You can buy internet daily that works all over the city ,6Euro. Window that opened wide.The location is steps from the river to walk to the Gallery or go threw the square and shop the market. Osteria across the street had great pizza and terrace. Laundry available but we did our own next door. We thought the room was big enough for exploring the city. Don't change a thing!

title: Efficient Staff, Comfortable Bed, Good Breakfast
review: This hotel is situated close to the station & close to the Cathedral Santa Maria del Fiore. The room & bathroom were really good. The bathroom was very spacious. The room was very clean & looked new. One of the best hotels I stayed in Italy. The breakfast was just great. A very large variety. Toast, ham, salami, bacon, eggs, variety of delicious pastries, croissants, cereal, yoghurt & fruits, tea & coffee. We stayed here for 2 days. The staff were very helpful. I had problems opening the door, & when i went down to reception & told them, they immediately sent someone to show me how to open the door. We even got a free bottle of water in the room.Loved this hotel & so did everyone else on this tour. The only thin that was not very good was the dinner we had one the first night.…

title: Average hotel in a very good location
review: Many thanks for your kind and detailed review, it's really a pleasure for us read that you enjoied your stay at our hotel. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.  Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Lovely place to stay
review: The exterior and entrance of the Grand Hotel Adriatico is a bit of a worry on first approach - it's boarded up with plywood and it isn't terribly obvious where you actually go to get in to the place. However, once inside (via the car park) it's fine and the room we were allocated on the sixth floor was nice enough - clean, functional and with a very comfortable bed, really good pillows and good quality linen which appeared to be changed every day.  It's true that the decor is a bit dated but it's not a massively expensive hotel and the staff are super efficient and genuinely responded immediately to the few requests we made. The only aspect of this hotel that really lets it down however is the lack of comfortable public space downstairs. This could be because it is in the…

title: Wonderful location
review: We stayed for 5 days in this hotel. The location is very good, close to the main train station if you are planning day trips ( we went to Pisa and the Mall) The room was decent , a bit old style and no tea/coffee facility provided. There is no room service in this hotel and the breakfast is poor.

review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great as a base
review: This hotel was great for us, an ideal situation as realively close to all sights to see.  As you wandered about , you came across things, literally around the corner.  Not as far to the iconic areas as you think.  The duomo, maybe 10 minutes.  Santa nouvella church 5 minutes.  Meals were breakfast included, which had a good selection of hot and cold.   On visiting the church's, be advised to take something to cover your shoulders, even the men. After queueing for the duomo for about half an hour, we got to front of the line to find out that security wouldn't allow son in with a vest top on.  Legs need to be covered at least to knee height.  If you visit the Santa nouvella church first, €5, if I remember rightly, they give you a cover up to wear around the church. KEEP THIS AND…

title: Very nice property!!
review: We stayed here for 3 days as part of our honeymoon and were pleasantly surprised by the standard of our room. Very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The reception area needs updated but that didn't affect our stay. Breakfast was adequate for us with cereals, croissants and some hot food. Very easy for us to walk around Florence from this hotel. Would recommend.

title: GREAT HOTEL
review: This hotel is in a fairly good location with many great restaurants nearby (see my review for Trattoria Armando, yum!). Most of the major attractions were at least a 15 min walk away, depending on your pace. The bathroom was clean and very spacious,  and offered a hair dryer and toiletries. Like most European hotels, small wash cloths aren't provided (just hand and bath towels), so bring your own if you use one. Breakfast was good, consisting of pastries, meats, cheeses, hardboiled eggs, and fruit. A nice outdoor seating area is an option. All in all, this was the most comfortable hotel during our seven nights around Italy.

title: Flying visit
review: The only problem, the wifi worked best in the hotel lobby.  It kicked out if you put your device down for a minute and then was difficult to reconnect.  The room was really nice, the double bed was very comfortable.  The shower pressure was good, but the short wall allowed water to escape all over the place.  Breakfast was really good, many options.  I loved the croissants with orange jelly!!  The staff was always courteous and helpful.

review: Very nice hotel! 10 minutes walking distance to the big monuments worth to see in the city. Nice room, nice fitness centre, (although a little small and warm.)  Ok rooms, cleaning around 1 pm. Two pillows per person, and you need both!

title: good hotel
review: The staff is nice the room is ok, clean and the bed is comfortable. But, about the breakfast.... It's so sad. The variation is poor and under the quality. The location is quite good, the main bridge it's around 10 min. I'm happy because of the opportunity to have this night with discount. But in full price I absolutely not recommend it!!

title: Worse the money
review: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights as part of a travel group. It was a decent sized room with a great bathroom. I stayed in 5 hotels during my 2 week trip around Italy and this was my best bathroom and shower. Bed was comfy and the AC was good. Good wifi. The hotel doesnt have that much Italian charm to it. It is in a great location in that you can walk for about ten minutes and be at most of the tourist spots. The breakfast was the most uneventful of my 5 hotel stays.  It was more of just bland foods and nothing standing out to my boyfriend and I as very italian.

title: Nice hotel bad surrounding area dated rooms terrible breakfast
review: Perfect location, clean rooms, not very spacious. Breakfast very poor and same every morning of our 7 days stay. Very polite and wonderfull personnel. Parking places very small (in case the car is a bit more than mini class, no space for opening the doors.

review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Perfect Location
review: We stumbled upon this restaurant attached to the hotel on our way back from sightseeing and eventually hesitated going in as we were wearing shorts and t-shirts and it looked very posh. We couldn't have been more wrong! We were welcomed with much style and understated elegance and made to feel fantastic. Our waiter Geronimo spoke excellent English and provided a fantastic history of Tuscan food and wines. We had the Tuscan experience menu and by far the best food we had during our week's stay around Italy. It provided us with a memory we will treasure and a must to see and return to. Can't recommend highly enough. Superb!

title: Nice, but bring a fan
review: The hotel is close enough to the train station for walking with your luggage and far enough away in a nicer area.  The breakfast was amazing and the rooms well appointed and quiet. The staff is very helpful and respectful.

title: Very good
review: I was completely impressed with this hotel in so many ways. I arrived for a 3 night stay with a terribly painful back issue which resulted in being taken to hospital, the staff , in particular Elissia  who went over and above her duty in organising a taxi driver, translating for us,  speaking to a friend over the phone, checking to make sure I was ok etc...warmth and compassion goes a long way when you are in a foreign country and unwell, Thankyou so much! You take pride in your work and that radiates to your guests. The hotel itself was amazingly good! Great location very close walk to Maria novella station. Rooms spacious, warm decor and tastefully done, breakfast was very good with a great choice of fruits, croissants,  pastries, cereals, many flavours of yoghurt along with…

title: Visit to Florence
review: We stayed her here a few nights and found the hotel very good. The rooms are spacious and clean and the staff were pretty good. The breakfast is average but just enough. There is a laundry 2 doors down and you can do your own laundry there if you choose. There is also a restaurant on the corner opposite the hotel which is very good and reasonably priced, its worth a visit.

title: Stay
review: At first many thanks for the time spent for this review which is important for us and thanks also for the nice words about your stay. Hoping to welcome you again, please accept our best regards.    Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: For what it was it worked out
review: Myself and members of my family (12 in total) were there to attend a wedding just outside Florence and when booking this hotel it was thought by the advertising that it is central to most things, this was not the case and we had to use taxis (Very Expensive) to visit various places and also the swimming lidos for the children as there is absolutely nothing at the hotel it is literally just a base. The rooms were clean and tidy and the cleaning staff were very good and very polite. The drinks within the hotel were very expensive especially for the soft drinks for the children. I had an issue when checking out as I was told a figure had to be paid which was excluding the deposit which I had already paid for the 5 rooms and he completely ignored what I was trying to explain to him.…

title: A surprisingly pleasant stay
review: Thanks to send us this review with your impressions about your stay; I confirm that next time, if you need an hotel with swimming pool, check better and choose one that has one, is not easy to find one in the center of Florence considerning the history of all the Florentine buildings. Our hotel is located at 3 minutes walking from Santa Maria Novella train Sation and one minute walking from the river Arno; also the most important monuments as the Ponte Vecchio and the Uffizi Gallery, The Cathedral and the Baptistery, San Lorenzo and Santa Croce, Palazzo Pitti and Boboli Garden are at about 10/15 minutes walking and walking you can see and discover all the beauties that Florence offer !!!!! About the problem you had at the check out, you prepaid a part of the 5 rooms you booked and you had to complete the payment at your departure and the collegue on duty tried to explain to you this, booking.com has nothing to do in this case because the question was only between our hotel and you and we never claim more money than agreed with the booking.  Best regards. Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: A good hotel overall
review: I would rate this hotel as a average because it worked out for the 3 days I was there, The neighborhood isn't the most attractive but within walking distance to major sights. Major problem with my stay was they said my room was ready and when I went in it was in a mess and not been cleaned. I waited a long while before it was ready but afterwards it was fine in terms of service and the room was in decent shape though dated in certain aspects. Rooms seem to be in better condition than common areas.  I do have a problem with the fact this is considered a 4 star when it is quite beaten down, most of the furniture/rugs in the common areas are very worn, stained and dated. Breakfast was fine and staff was friendly and helpful. Overall I believe that this is good for a quick stay but…

title: Lovely hotel
review: We stayed in this hotel for six nights, initially a gamble, turning out a right choice and satisfaction overall.   The hotel sits not far from the main train station, SMN, easy to walk to the place, for us to go to Siena, Venice, and Pisa, by bus or train, but not too close to be annoyed by constant crowds around the station, nearer streets leading to city centre. The three automatic doors separate inner hotel from outside, making guests feel cool at entering in the heat of summer (one of my favourites). The room has a view of mountains and city buildings, like a postcard picture. The huge bed is extremely comfortable, and TV has quite a few English news and entertainment channels, not so common for four-star hotels in Italy.  Room rate included breakfast, which is a big plus,…

title: Good hotel
review: Great hotel outside the main Florence's  touristy centre so a little quieter but still close to everything. The hotel and rooms were great & most staff were pleasant & friendly especially in the breakfast area & the restaurant. Air conditioning & wifi worked well, our shower was over the bath which may be inconvenient for some guests & some rooms had a balcony so if these are important you might need make a special request when booking. There was a pillow menu & cute 'his & her' towels in the bathroom. Breakfast was good. LOCATION was convenient: Walking distance to most points of interest: Duomo, Arno River, Pont Vecchio, Piazza della Republica  10 mins walk from train station Santa Maria Novella which we found very convenient.  RESTAURANTS: There is a great restaurant on site…

title: A Lovely Place to Stay
review: Booked this hotel based on some reviews and it turned out to be really nice. The room and washroom are spacious. Breakfast was good and had a small Chinese section. As much as I like the international fare, the staple Asian junk food instant noodle was a really welcomed sight. Thumbs up 👍🏼. Would be better if it were prepared with boiling water instead of hot water from a flask.  Highly recommend this for your stay in Florence
