review: Staff efficient and friendly even when dealing with the hotel before arriving. Lovely and friendly front desk staff who were always willing to deal with any enquiry. The hotel is a few minutes walk from il Centro Storico so is well placed as a base to explore the city. Easy to get to from the airport as its a 15 minute taxi ride. Not top class luxury but great value for money 👍🏼

title: Uitstekend hotel - Excellent hotel
review: Room excellent, Location brilliant . Five minutes walk from train station. Would totally recommend touring along the river , go off over the bridges and you will see everything. Well worth a visit . We loved it  , architecture amazing..

review: At first many thanks for this wonderful comment, WE are very pleased to read the satisfaction in the comments of our customers as we work hard for this ! Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager.

title: Nice hotel in a good location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Quiet Hotel
review: We only stayed at Adriatico for one night, but we couldn't have been happier with the experience.  It was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see, the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good.  Our room was clean and in good condition with a massive bathroom.

title: Great location
review: Thanks a lot for this short but complete review which is really important for us. We are happy to read comments like your as we really work hard to try to satisfy all the expectations of our customers. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards,   Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Good location and nice service
review: Very good location as it is a couple of streets away from the Santa Maria Train Station, situated in a very quiet and peaceful street.We requested an iron bank and a bucket of ice and they were very responsive to all our request. Usually, there are no ACs in Europe in the months of March and April, however they were very helpful in providing us with a fan.

title: Fabulous hotel, fabulous location
review: Many thanks for this short but completed review, it's important for us to know our Client's impressions. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico again, please accept our best regards.    Daniele Benelli   Assistant Manager

title: Lovely hotel, good location
review: We stayed one night at the Grand Hotel Adriatico in Florence. The hotel was clean but the room was unusually laid out.  Breakfast was good and the hotel was located in a very good location for visiting the sights of Florence.

title: Excellent rooms and service
review: Thanks a lot for this short review and for the nice words spent about us. I do not understand what you mean with "unusually laid out" and if you could send me more details maybe I'llbe able to answer to you !  Best regards.    Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: A normal hotel with good location
review: This was our second visit to this hotel, which shows that we like it very much! The location is very convenient for arriving by train or using airport shuttles and all the major tourist attractions are within easy walking distance which is a huge bonus as Florence is such a wonderful place to walk around. Our room was a good size with warm coloured decor and beautiful wooden floor. Bathroom was also large and clean with complementary toiletries -/though the shower door leaked! Breakfast was generous with a super array of fruit, delicious pastries, breads and cereals. We aren't fans of cooked breakfast anyway so the lack of a range of hot food didn't worry us at all . We found the staff very friendly and helpful at all times . I hope we will have the chance to visit again!

title: Hotel itself looks modern  and clean BUT....
review: Thank you for this nice review, very important for us.It gratifies us always read the satisfaction of our customers and in fact we work for it, to improve ourselves and to offer more and better services. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: A Very Nice Florence Hotel
review: Close to the train station, Santa Maria Novella, hardly a kilometre away, the hotel scores high on location and comfort. No frills room, functional bathroom with a narrow bath tub, coffee maker, standard bed. View from our window was a mixed bag of old residences and the Duomo.   It has a full fledged bar and kitchen. Breakfast was elaborate in terms of the choice of bread and fresh cut fruits.  But no egg.   I think they cater to typical tourists, who transit from here to Rome, may be stop for a night or two, catch Duomo, Michelangelo's David in the original  at the Gallery. For Anil and me Florence was the highlight of our whole 25 day Europe trip as we went for this spectacular Cinque Terre hike !!!   Most of the staff here spoke English fairly passably.     The rooms are…

title: Mr. Visitor
review: I was able to book this hotel on Expedia as part of my flight+hotel package and was happily surprised. This is not a 5-star hotel by any means, but the staff and service were excellent and accommodating, and the hotel was very clean and operative. My room was small - I was traveling alone on this trip and had booked a single. But the room and bathroom were fine for my needs. This time of year (April) created a challenge for them - the air conditioning system hadn't been started yet and the weather suddenly turned warm - 75 degrees Fahrenheit during the day. My room was very warm - luckily the staff was able to meet my request for a fan and that helped immensely. The included breakfast was an added bonus.

title: Nice Hotel, Pleasant Staff
review: Thanks a lot for the nice words spent in this review about our hotel. I'm sorry for the high temperatures of the rooms but in a few days we went from having 8/10 degrees to 24/28 degrees and it gave us little bit trouble. Now of course the air conditioning was turned on to the delight of our customers. Hoping to welcome you again, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Awesome!!
review: Well, you'll never guess what a nice hotel it is from the outside. In spite of the shabby facade, it is a decent 4 star hotel with clean and modern suites. It is so close to the central train station as well as to the historical centre that you'll never use a taxi except for visiting suburbs. I was really impressed how value for money principle suited it.

title: Great hotel and great breakfast
review: Family hotel room for 5 nights in Florence close to main train station. The room was spacious and 'U' shaped allowing for some privacy. A little cramped for a family of four, but what we expected. Room facilities were sufficient, but small TV (not that we spent time watching) and no tea and coffee facilities, which would have been nice.  The breakfast was a little disappointing and never changed each day, just the same basic buffet.  Staff were friendly and very helpful - we screwed up with the safe one day and they sorted it quickly and efficiently.

title: Convenient Location
review: Thanks a lot for your review which is important for us and thanks also for the nice words spent. Concerning the kettle for coffe and tea we have many available and you could ask for one and it was a pleasure for us to put one in your room. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Great hotel in beautiful Florence
review: Stayed here from March 20 to 23,2016  The regular room at this hotel is very spacious. Enough space for your luggage, plenty of space to move around.   The bathroom is big as well.   Generally helpful hotel staff.  This hotel is a few minutes away from the train station and the Arno river. It is also close to restaurants and shops.  Breakfast was good. They offered scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, a salad bar, juice and milk, several kinds of bread and pastries, cereal, several kinds of fruits including peaches, pineapples, oranges and kiwi.   Wifi connection was fast but it kept on requiring me to log in every so and so. I already memorized the password.  The only problem that I encountered was this hotel's airconditioning system did not operate during our time of stay. They…

title: Great place to stay
review: Many thanks for time spent for this review and also for the nice words, we are happy to read our Client's satisfaction. Concerning our wi fi we are going to change the password system as for some types of phones, like your, every time you must put the password again. In March you cannot turn on the air conditioning given also the low temperatures especially in the morning a few times where it exceeds 0 degrees and you need heating. In spring the air is regularly working. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: In the heart of Florence!
review: The hotel was conveniently located close to the main train station (which was great as we arrived and left Florence by train) and within walking distance of all the main sites. The room was very clean and staff were generally friendly and helpful. Our room had a wonderful view of the city including the Duomo and of the hills behind Florence. A number of reasonably-priced restaurants are located nearby and we felt very safe walking back to the hotel each night. Breakfast was included and was enough to start the day. This is a great hotel for families and couples.

title: Perfect!
review: Many thanks for this kind, short and complete review which is really important for us. We love to read our Client's satisfaction, that means for us that we worked well. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, plase accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Unassuming Hotel
review: The  Grand Hotel Adriatico is located in the heart of Florence, great location, about a 10 minute walk from the Duomo, 2 minute walk to the Arno River.  Close to the Santa Maria Novella Station.  The Adriatico’s restaurant specializes in traditional Tuscan dishes and wines, plus Italian favorites.  The rooms are a nice size, the bathroom was large for a European hotel.

title: WALKING DISTANCE FROM RAILWAYS STATION AND HISTORICAL CITY CENTER
review: Many thanks for your wonderful review, we are really glad when our Clients had a good time at our Hotel and appreciate all our services. We hope to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico. With best regards Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Adequate
review: The hotel is located really close to the main train station, so if you are traveling by train it is quite convenient. There are several dining options in the area. The rooms are a bit outdated, but clean. The breakfast buffet had a nice, small selection of hot and cold options.

title: Mediocre
review: Thanks for leaving this review whixh is really important for us and thanks also for the nice words.  Best regards.    Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: No Surprises - Clean and Quiet
review: An adequate 4 star hotel that has seen better days. Peak season rates are ludicrous for vibe quality but thankfully we were there off-season. The restaurant is poor, more like home-cooking than fine dining. The bar is small and lacks atmosphere and the breakfast is OK if you stick to the cold buffet. Having said all that the bedroom was nice and the bed very comfortable. There is also a choice of pillows.

title: Very close to station and walking distance to most other things
review: Hotel and staff were perfectly fine and most of the basics were well covered alongside a good location.  Issues that I experienced were: - on turning on each tap in the bathroom, the water was a dark brown for c 10 seconds. This did clear - although grit in bath tub had to be washed away - possibly linked to above, the room smelt 'stale' - the gym was very poor and might as well be converted to a guest room - at c 7pm the bar was unstaffed and had zero atmosphere. Not necessarily an issue but be conscious booking this as a hotel you don't venture from  The rooms were also very noisy from bells etc in the morning - this can be seen as either charming or annoying!  Having said that, if I had another booking I wouldn't cancel. Equally I would roll the dice on somewhere else when I…

title: Great hotel for a great price & great location
review: Real good location, nice friendly staff, food average, rooms paper thin and noisy. Noisy part of Florence, right next to apt building. Good price for value. Pro-active and flexible staff who are very courteous. A chain hotel that grinds the guests in and out. Crowded as expected. Good value for money.

title: Nice and Expensive
review: Thanks for this short review which is important for us. Best regards.  Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Great Location!
review: The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk to the train station.  It is less than a 30 minute walk to all other Florence must-sees; including the incredible shopping. The included breakfast is quite varied from scrambled eggs to cereal to the traditional Itailian breakfast.  The room is clean, not super large, but plenty of room.  The bathroom is well appointed and very clean.  The desk staff spoke excellent English and could not have been more helpful.    The only drawbacks that we had is that the bed & pillows are hard.  I think just adding a nice mattress pad would improve the bed immensely.  The only other thing that each person in our travel group noticed is that the shower door does not seal well and is not quite long enough to keep the water from the shower in the tub.  You…

title: Great Location
review: Thanks a lot for this detailed review which is very helpful for us. Thanks also for the nice words spent about our hotel, our services and our staff; concerning the problem you had with the bed and the pillows I inform you that in all our rooms there is a pillow menu and you could choose the one you preferred between 3 different models. The same goes for the mattresses because ours are orthopedic and for someone a little hard but we also have softer mattresses available. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.                                         Daniele Benelli   Assistant Manager

title: Sight Seeing and  Womans Paradise for Shopping
review: I've been travelling to Florence for over twenty years and have often stayed at the Adriatico. The position is very good, close to the station and a pleasant stroll along the river to the Ponte Vecchio. The rooms and bathrooms are extremely clean and comfortable with good quality bed linen, the staff very helpful. Price/ Quality ratio pretty good ( I tend to go when demand is very high). I would be happy to recommend this establishment

title: Good hotel!
review: The Hotel is located not far from the Santa Maria Novella Train station approx 15minutes easy walk.The rooms are very nice and clean, the service  is very good and staff members are very helpful and free advice.

title: Good hotel with good price
review: Many thanks for this short review, our hotel is located less than 5 minutes walking away from the train station of Santa Maria Novella and 10 minutes walking from the Ponte Vecchi or the Duomo. Best regards.   Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Clean, comfy beds, excellent service
review: Very easy to get to from the train station...10 minutes to walk. The hotel sits in a dirty and dubious area but we did not have any problems. We did not like the breakfast and the bed was uncomfortable. Staff were friendly. Scott

title: LOVED IT!!
review: Thanks for this short review which is very important for us, Our hotel is located at 3/4 minutes walking from the train staion of Santa Maria Novella and 10 minutes from the Cathedral or the Ponte Vecchio in the residential area of Borgognissanti. Our beds are equipped with othopedic matresses and you could ask our reception and we had the possibility to change it. Best regards.     Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Good location, well decorated hotel lobby but the room is better to be refurbished
review: We were very happy with this hotel.   All was very clean. Rooms have hardwood floors (very clean). Bed was king-sized and comfortable, and when we asked for extra pillows, they brought them instantly (and they offer pillows of varied firmness). We also complained about a squeaky bathroom door and they took care of that immediately too. Room was dark and quiet for sleeping.  Bathroom had a nice marble counter and was clean. It had the usual half-door on the shower that you often see in European showers, so it was hard not to get water on the floor, but that seems to be the European way. There was some peeling paint on the back of the bathroom door (surely from steam from showers), but that did not bother us.  Buffet breakfasts were good, though we mostly just ate fruit and nice…

review: Thanks a lot for this wonderful and complete review, we are very proud to read our Client's satisfaction and it's really important for us to know their opinion. title: great 4* hotel close to everything you need to see in Florence
review: Beautiful walkway from front entrance to hotel foyer with décor of quiet opulence. Spacious, clean, and nicely appointed room finished in Florentine style with heavy drapes and reddish wall coverings. Less than 5 min walk to Firenze Santa Maria Novella train station. Wide selection for breakfast to suit all tastes and preferences. Lots of eateries and convenience stores downstairs and within a block radius. Easy access to San Lorenzo Market, Cathedral of Santa Maria dei Fiori, and Ponte Vecchio. Stayed 3 happy nights.

title: Fantastic Hotel for the Value
review: Thanks a lot for this wonderful review which is important for us. We love to read our Client's satisfaction and see that that they liked our hotel, our staff and all our services. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, we wish you a Merry Christmas and an happy new year 2016.   Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Great hotel and friendly staff
review: Included is a great breakfast ( eggs, bacon,fruit, pastries, toast etc ), from 6:30 am holds you till afternoon as you walk this great old city. most Staff quite helpful. Rooms very clean, colourful with old world feel. A little more than the Best Western across St but has upscale restaurant ...only block from river Arno , easy walking to all important sights

title: Above average hotel, comfortable and well run.
review: Thanks a lot for this review which is really important for us and thanks for the nice words. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, also for finishing your visit, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: One of the Best Run Hotels
review: It is not easy to get to a hotel downtown Florenze, and it took us a while to find it. Grand Hotel Adriatico was chosen because of its proximity to the sights of Florence and because we need to do some meetings in the neighbourhood. The hotel has its own parking, which is very convenient.  The rooms are large and charming - gives a good Florentine experience. Nice service, Reasonable breakfast buffet (compared to Italian tradition) and good service. Wifi is not fast and stable, but it works.

title: Great location
review: Many thanks for your nice review, we are really glad when our Clients had a good time at our Hotel and appreciate all our services. We hope to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico. With best regards Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: memorable stay
review: Staff was very attentive and caring.  Great breakfast.  Wonderful location -- 10 minute walk from train station. Has an agreement with Florence Fitness where you can go workout. Rooms are immaculate.  Everything was top notch.  Enjoyed our stay tremendously.  They even offer an array of pillows to choose from. Staff speaks English really well and is attentive to your needs.  Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent stay
review: Many thanks for this kind and complete review which is really important for us; it's a good thing for us to read that you enjoyed our hotel, our services and our staff. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.   Daniele Benelli   Assistant Manager

title: Easy to find, on site parking and decent rooms
review: This has been a great place to stay. It's quiet, fairly modern, clean and convenient to all the sights in Florence. It's only about a 5 minute walk from the train station.    The staff is friendly and try to be helpful.   The rooms a a little small but adequate. Wish they had a little more AMERICAN tv. The shower/tub has plenty of hot water and the pressure is good.   The breakfast is also very good. Everything you could ever ask for. You can order any kind of coffee you want  Oh by the way there is a coin laundry 2 doors down from the hotel. Yes they have a small bar also.

title: Rather modern hotel
review: Many thanks for the time spent for this review which is really important for us. Thanks a lot for the kind words and I hope to welcome you again here at the Best Western Grand Hotel Adriatico. Best regards, Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Great Stay, Great Location!
review: Given the nature of local road systems, this one is pretty easy to find and has on site parking. Note that parking is accessible via an intercom accessed gate just to the left of the main entrance. Nice quiet rooms and helpful staff. Nothing to dislike.

title: Great location

title: A good hotel near train station and attractions.
review: Thanks a lot for this review which is really important for us and thanks for the nice words. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, also for finishing your visit, please accept our best regards.     Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: A Good Value and Good Location in Florence
review: The location of the hotel is just fantastic – almost every place you might want to go to is at a walking distance – plus when in Florence we must walk, walk and walk!  Cleanliness: The hotel (the reception lobby, elevators, rooms, common areas) was immaculate.  Comfort: Our stay was very comfortable. The ambiance is cosy and warm.  Facilities: They have shower, soap/shampoo/conditioner etc, LCD TV, telephone in room, restaurant & bar.  Food & Drink: The restaurant serves breakfast, lunch & dinner. We had their breakfast which was absolutely lovely. It seems, you can enjoy the breakfast in the private yard area as well, but only during summers.  Location: Hotel Adriatico is located in central Florence on Santa Maria Novella – just a 10 or so minutes’ walk from Santa Maria Novella…

review: Thank you for this lovely and detailed review, it's really important for us to see that ou Clients enjoyed our Hotel, our staff and all our services. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.   Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: "Convenient For Train Travelers"
review: It is hardly a 5 minute walk from the train station and a 5 min walk from the bridge that connects the east and west of the city. The rooms are pretty comfortable and spacious and the service good. The hotel is also close to many of the attractions of the city. There are lots of food options nearby and hence it offers a good location at a reasonable price.

title: Lovely hotel and good breakfast. Free wifi.
review: At first many thanks for the time spent for this review which is really important for us and thanks also for the nice words, it's really a good thing for us to see that our hotel and our services are appreciated by our Clients. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept all our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Revamped
review: I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the train station and the center of town. I was not disappointed because we had easy access to all attractions. The room and bathroom were clean and beds were comfortable. The air conditioner worked well. The free WIFI worked well and the breakfast was very good.The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful in getting us a cab back to the train station. Even though the train station is close with heavy bags  a short cab ride was more convenient.  The following is of no reflection on this hotel. I have to mention that I was very intimidated by the aggressiveness of the refugees selling their wares in this town. They pushed items in our face at many of the places we went to, even in some outdoor eateries.  I was verbally insulted by…

title: Clean, spacious, up-to-date American-style rooms.
review: Thanks a lot for the nice comment about our hotel and for the time spent to write it. It's a good thing for us to know out Client's impressions about our hote, our staff and our services. I'm sorry for the troubles you had in our town during your visit with this person  Best regards.    Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Great location, clean room, bad internet and breakfast
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Short and lovely trip
review: The location was great, very close to the SMN train station and city center.  The rooms were very clean.  However, there was bad internet connection in the room and then no internet service at all the last night we were there.  Breakfast was very poor.

title: Gateway to Firenze!
review: Thanks a lot for this review which is important for us. We are happy you had a great time with us and I'm sorry for the wi fi but we had few problems that now are fixed. Hoping to welcome you again please accept our best regards.     Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: Good hotel with very good service
review: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for just one night . This hotel is 5-7 min walking distance from the train station and 10-15 min walk from the main attractions . Room was very clean n so was the bathroom . Breakfast was good with a selection of bread , cereal , juice , few hot dishes n hot drinks . Staff was helpful n polite . I booked this hotel coz of its location n i am glad i did . I read some reviews that area is bit dodgy . We were two female travellers n we didnt find it unsafe spl if you walk towards ponte viccho area . Very conveninet location . Good hotel .

title: A pleasent confirmation
review: Many thanks for this wonderful review which is really important for us and many thanks for the wonderful words. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our warms regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Excellent Value, Worthwhile Option
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Excellent hotel
review: This hotel in central Florence is a great option that does not break the bank. The location is ideal as it is within an easy walk of both the train station and the major attractions of Florence. The curb appeal is not anything special but that belies the lovely interior. The rooms are rather nice, the morning breakfast is well done and the staff are quite accommodating and helpful. The room rates are very reasonable considering the quality of the product.  For our visit to Florence, we wanted to spend two days and were interested in a hotel that was close to the major attractions at a moderate price. This hotel jumped out when I investigated the options. As a Best Western Rewards Platinum Member, I am generally happy to give properties in this chain a try. Typically, I find that…

title: Maravilloso
review: Many thanks for the time spent for theis review and many thanks also for the very nice review which is really important for us. Hoping to welcome you again at the grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept all our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Great Value in Florence
review: Stayed at the hotel for two nights ... This hotel was perfectly situated at the Center of the city . The rooms were beautiful and clean. Everything is close by. The staff were friendly especially at the breakfast place. Enjoyed our stay and totally recommend it to whoever is visiting Florence and u get what u pay for.

title: NIce clean Hotel with a great location
review: Many thanks for your wonderful review which is really important for my staff and me. We love to read when our Clients loved thei stay with us. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: bad mannered staff, huge rooms, close to train station, BAD Wifi!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Conveniently located modest city hotel
review: this hotel has huge rooms, rooms are soo big you can walk inside the closet! the rooms are huge, but the wifi is bad, doesnt work most of the time in the rooms (maybe because we were in the 7th floor, i am nor sure)  neighberhood is not perfect (not classy at all), dirty and full with fast food restaurant and minimarkets, but close to train station.   globally OK, we stayed 1 night. breakfast very normal.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Thanks for the time spent for this review and thanks for the nice words. I'm sorry for internet but normally it works maybe you had to ask to our recptionist and they were able to help you. Best regards.     Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Good hotel
review: Friendly chain hotel in a slightly dodgy area near the train station but 10 minute walk from Ponte Vecchio. Standard rooms are on the small side and the plumbing is eccentric. Rooms are clean and freshly laundered. Breakfast is adequate if unexciting but could do with fresh fruit. Besides the small garden patio there is a restaurant for evening meals but we rarely saw anybody there. Given the number of small restaurants in all the surrounding streets there is no problem finding a meal provided you are not unnerved by the local colour. No pool but room air conditioning for August 38 deg was reliable and quiet. Friendly helpful staff. Good value.

title: There are better options!
review: Thanks a lot for the time spent for your review that we consider very important to know the opinion of our customers. It helps us to see how we could improve all our services to make the stay of our customers unforgettable. Hoping to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico. With best rergards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Nice florentine hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Faultless!
review: One of the few hotels that can accommodate a family of four in one room. Stayed for 3 nights before going into Tuscany and Umbria, the hotel is in a small square and does not boast an attractive frontage especially with people hanging around at all hours. However the hotel is clean, professional with a nice breakfast and late night bar. Wifi was mixed in parts of our room and no English TV for the kids other than BBC news, however that wasn't too bad a thing! I'd recommend this hotel as its a short walk from the Arno and good value.

title: Good location.
review: Thanks a lot for this wonderful rerview which is really important for us, we are really happy ro read that our Clients enjoyed their stay in our hotel and enjoyed all our services. I hope to welcome you again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico and please accept our my best regards. Daniele Benelli      Assistant Manager

title: Great location
review: When booking through a travel company a hotel of this standard is often not included.  Thankfully, I really enjoyed my five nights at this comfortable and friendly hotel. The Best Western Group have minimum standards and I have always been impressed by their level of care. The room I had was tastefully decorated in "Tuscan" colours and fully equipped with everything one could possibly need.  The buffet breakfast had a wide range of alternatives to suit every taste.  The service in the breakfast room was excellent even at the busiest times of the morning probably because breakfast was available from 6.30 to 10.30 am.  There were limited spaces to eat al fresco in the hotel's courtyard garden which also was pleasantly cooled by large parasols and acted as an extension to the bar…

title: Florence and Best Western Grand Hotel Adriatico
review: Many thanks for your kind words, it's nice to see that you had a really good impression about our hotel. Your review is important for us to try to improve all our services. Hoping to see you again at our hotel please accept our best regards. Daniele Benelli Assistant Manager

title: Very good location and high quality
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Perfect for a city trip!
review: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in July 2015. The hotel is very well located between train station and the river on rather quiet street. It is close to the old town, to the Ponte Vecchio and Fortress da Basso as well as Basilique Santa Croce de Florence. My room was nicely decorated and despite very hot weather (37-39 C) the AC was efficient enough to provide reasonably temperature in my room. Breakfast was good and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The only complaint is that Wi-Fi (although free of charge) was rather slow. Nevertheless I recommend this hotel.

title: Very nice hotel
review: The hotel is in the center of Florence close to the railway station. It's on walking distance from the old center and all the interesting places to visit in Florence. Interesting is that the hotel has a private parking area. Breakfast is good in quantity and quality. Friendly staff. Rooms are clean and have enough space. Ideal location for a city trip but also for a meeting.

title: Modern accommodations
review: I would recommend this hotel as it was perfect for our stay. We needed to be fairly close to the station in order to visit Rome and Venice. This hotel is about 5 minutes walk away from SMN. If you don't need that perhaps staying nearer Ponte Vecchio or the Duomo would be nicer. The rooms at the Grand Adriatico are average size but clean, comfortable and cool. The temps were v high when we were there and we were pleasantly surprised that the a/c was kept on continuously so we slept well. The bathrooms are well equipped and the power shower great, although the water was only tepid. No problem for us though. The English TV channels are limited: only BBC news was available. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed spending time in the hotel bar too where the…

title: Great Location
review: We stayed three nights and found the room very modern. We enjoyed the air conditioning after shopping and visiting historic sites. You can walk easily to stores, the river, museums, and churches. Although they do not have a fitness center, they provided a voucher for gym about one block away that offered cardio, classes, free wights, and machines.

title: Spacious room, polite staff and quiet surroundings!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: A good place to stay when visitng Florence
review: We were given the room at 1200hrs as we had reached early even though the normal check-in time is 1400 hrs. The hotel staff was very polite and helpful. We were given a room at the end of the first floor but, the room was very spacious, more than expected hence no complains about the corner room. Hotel is quite old but it is maintained. It is a bit not much far from the city centre (10-12mins walking), there is a pizzeria and a kebab place ( 5 min walking distance) near the hotel which is open till midnight. Everything else is shut by 7 in the evening.  Overall a good experience.  P.S: Free wifi has okay speed in the rooms. Good speed in the lobby. City tax is a general thing in Italy, so either on check-in or check-out, expect that coming.

title: Nice hotel
review: The hotel is situated at walking distance from most museums and other places of interest. Rooms are nicely equiped, breakfast is served at reasonable hours, good food quality and the famous  Italian coffee is there to top the experience.

title: Awesome Location
review: Great hotel with fantastic location, about 5mins walk to SMN train station and easy access to other point of attractions. There are plenty of great restaurants and mini market at neighbourhood area.   The room is clean although is a little small but still acceptable for us.  Nice buffet breakfast. Staff are courteous and super helpful, always ready to guide us whenever we need.

title: Oh, come on! -referring to review left by harditwj
review: Clean, quiet rooms.  Great location, walking distance to many Florence attractions. Beautiful walk to river.  Our Beds were uncomfortable.  My husband and I were in a room with 2 double beds, made with separate bedding, and way too hard.  Our boys shared a room with beds made into 1 bed with shared bedding.  I think they got this backwards!  The breakfast was average with a good selection of fresh fruit if you got their early.  Exceptionally friendly staff both at front desk and at breakfast.  My biggest complaint was the dinner.  We were booked here by the tour company as we are a large party of 18.  The dinner was Chicken/potatoes/risotto.  Nothing special.  When I asked for a salad I was given a salad gritty with dirt!  Seriously, they couldn't rinse the lettuce?  I would…

title: Nice room with impolite staff
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. title: Great location close to attractions
review: We booked via Agoda in the morning, but when arrived to check-in in midnight, our booking info was not there. The hotel entrance door was locked and the 'lobby' lights were turned off. The communications was done first through an intercom located at the door before we were allowed in after we insisted. The front desks were manned by two staffs, who eyed us suspiciously and kept asking questions when one of us was going to the toilet. We were informed that cars couldn't park in front of the hotel because it is resided in a residential area, but failed to informed us, as guests, where to park otherwise. If it was not due to exhaustion after a long drive, we might have decided to cancel our stay.  Another bad experience was at the breakfast. A friend unintentionally left his hat on…

title: A pleasant hotel in a great location
review: Many thanks for the time spent for this review. I'm really sorry for what happened with your reservation, but as our collegues on duty during the night told you, we never received your booking on our system (now is all automatic and normal it works very well). At your arrival, after midnight, they were not expecting other Clients and my collegues, as mormal, closed the doors. and they were suspicious to you just because you were unexpected for them and who works at night should also think about the safety of our customers.  Normal at our Client's arrival we always ask if they reached our hotel by car explaning that we have a parking available and when it is full we will direct them to a private garage which is two minutes walking away from our hotel. You can find all this informations also on our website. I saw on your review that you liked your rooms and I apologize for all the troubles you had with your booking ( I repeat now all is automatic and normal it works very well but sometimes could happen ) and I hope yu enjoyed your stay in our town. Best regards.    Daniele Benelli   Assistant Manager

title: An excellent hotel in a competitive market
review: Hotel was within walking distance of train station, area around hotel does not give great first impressions but inside hotel was lovely. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Room was of a good standard and breakfast was usual fare but good quality. Hotel was within 10 minutes of most attractions and always felt safe either by day or night when walking through city. Would return to hotel if visiting Florence in the future.

title: Solid hotel within walking distance from train
review: This hotel is very close the train station which is why we chose it. Very friendly staff and a decent room. Every restaurant we tried in the surrounding area was excellent. This hotel was exactly what we needed and we'd definitely stay here again.

title: Tourist experience in Rome
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Superb location
review: Lovely looking hotel close to train station. My second and last stay. Was here in 2005 and had no air conditioning (they told us too early in the season) - here in June 2015 and it is very warm - outside AND inside. The desk tells us there is nothing they can do . I would guess this is a great place to stay in cooler months.

title: Enjoyable stay, easy walk to most attractions
review: A great hotel, location is fab, cleanliness is very good and breakfast is tasty. The mattress and bed were really comfortable, the rooms were quiet and myself and husband enjoyed our four night stay.  Finding it hard to critique this place in any way and I would recommend highly.

title: Great location
review: Stayed here for two nights in May 2015 with three young adults.  The hotel was an easy 5 minute walk from the train station.  While other reviews commented on the sketchy neighborhood, we never had a concern or fear at all during our time here.  We walked to and from the train station very late and never had an issue.  As well, we walked to all the major tourist sites from the hotel, and enjoyed our walk each time.    We found the rooms to be very clean and comfortable, lobby was very nice for relaxing, and the staff were all very pleasant and helpful.  They helped us make dinner reservations and recommended sites to visit, provided maps, and answered all questions we had, being quite friendly and joking with us.  Breakfast was quite good and filling, with many different options…

title: COMFORTABLE AND CONVENIENT TO TRAIN
review: I stayed at the Best Western Grand Adriatico Hotel in Florence in May 2015 while vacationing in Florence.   The hotel was in a great location. Close to Santa Maria Novella train station in case you want to travel to other cities in Italy and that was also the area to meet several day trip companies for morning pickups. You are also a quick 15 minute walk to the Duomo and other attractions.   The room was nice. Shower was a little less than American but thats to be expected. The breakfast was great. Large selection of pasties, fruit, cereals, eggs and meats.  Variety of juices and coffees. The wait staff was very attentive.

title: Small, clean and well located
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: THE place to stay in Florence
review: We had four people staying in this "suite" and it actually worked quite well.  As we entered the room there were two single beds opposite each other and then around the corner the queen, the bathroom and the desk.  It worked for us.  Breakfast was good, it was very close to the train station which we wanted and was close to all the museums and the river and all the places we wanted to visit.  The lobby was very nice and the customer service adequate as well.  We had no issues with security or the location. They web claims they will put fresh flowers in your room and if you were expecting them, you will be disappointed.

title: Very good location
review: After a tour of Tuscany & Umbria, Grand Hotel Adriatico made the top of our list of hotels.  Best breakfast including salad, very attentive and pleasant breakfast room staff, comfortable room and convenient location (easy walk everywhere).

title: Security is a concern
review: Location is awesome,close to all attractions and train station, facilities are in a good condition, breakfast is not bad , free wifi, staff are friendly, I would very much recommend this hotel, well done!

title: Reasonable price and close to action
review: The Hotel Adriatico is convenient to the area we wanted to visit.  The location is actually quite good.  The hotel is modern and well maintained and we were looking forward to our stay.  However, my niece left her room for 15 minutes to come to our room which was down the hall. Within that time someone broke into her room and stole her laptop and some money.  They broke in by swiping a credit card through the lock.  There was no alarm indicating unauthorized entry.  There were no cameras to record the actions.  The hotel manager, although apologetic has not been able to settle her claim for reimbursement.   While loosing her lap top was upsetting, I shutter when i think of what could have happened.  She and her college roommate are 21 year old females and the perp had to be…

title: Good choice for train travellers
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Terrible.
review: Moving through Europe by rail, this hotel is a great choice. A short walk or embarrassingly short carbide from the station, it is handy to just about everything you want. For the traveller, there is a Laundromat a few doors down the street ( exit hotel and turn right) there is also mini-markets where you can pick up a few beers. Use this as a base and day trip by train to Pisa. ( buy ticket at the tobacconist but don't forget to validate it ).. friendly staff, plentiful breakfast

title: Good Choice
review: I do not usually write reviews, but this one I had to. Please safe yourself the trouble and look elsewhere. We enjoyed our experience at another best western hotel in Milan and decided to come here. However the hotel is in a sketchy neighborhood, and I did not feel safe walking back at night. Breakfast was under the average. Worst of all, the hotel is old and needs a serious renovation. The room seemed dirty and unclean when we arrived. It is overpriced for what it is and I'm sure there are plenty of better places around for that price.

title: All that you need
review: We stayed here two nights while on a tour.  While the neighborhood is somewhat sketchy it is a good location for getting around town.   There is also a self service laundry right next door which was a plus.  Our room was nice and comfortable. Breakfast was very good. Staff was accommodating.  We ate at a great restaurant across the street for dinner one night. Good food and service.

title: Great hotel in Florence near the train station
review: Great hotel! Peaceful place with kind service and abundant breakfast! Moreover, the location (next to the old center and close to the river) is a big point! Because you are not in the middle of touristic places but not far from them. Totally recommended!

title: Good Hotel in Good Location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good hotel, close to everything
review: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the Hotel very comfortable. Warm reception welcome, good breakfast buffet and reasonably good size quiet room.  It's proximity by foot to all the major attractions makes it a recommended places to stay.

title: Excellent value hotel restaurant
review: Very nice hotel, not far from any sites and close to station/bus,etc.  Breakfast is typical continental with lot of sweet pastries.   Georgia makes the best cappuccino:-)  Beds are nice and firm just the way I like.

title: Great stopover in the heart of beautiful Florence!
review: Can't find a separate listing for the restaurant but it offers an excellent value 3 course meal including cover, wine and food for only 28 euros. The food is reasonable and in fact, far better than the price would suggest.

title: Nice, typical chain hotel that meets expectations
review: I last visited the hotel in 2004 and I don't remember it being a Best Western back then.  However, it was as good then as it is now... or vice versa!   Great location for those arriving to Florence by train (it's just 10mins walk to and from Florence S.ta Maria Novella railway station) and/or by car (they hv car parking facilities at the back of the hotel at a reasonable daily charge.  It is also only a few mins away fm my favourite Florence restaurant, the historical Il Latini in Via dei Palchetti, so a win-win situation.   Quality bed linen and towels, some rooms better than others, but I loved mine and I shall definitely return and ask for the very same room. Generous breakfast in the mornings, the best way to kick-start a day of sightseeing.

title: Nice Room, Very Near Historic Center
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Book early
review: Our room was quite nice, very clean.  I doubt any rooms have a "view", but the hotel is located within walking distance of most historic attractions making it very convenient.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The breakfast buffet was good, but not extensive.  There are lots of restaurants nearby.  The elevator might be a bit small if traveling with a wheelchair.

title: Very good hotel.  Central location but also not too far from the station
review: We booked this hotel a few months before- very reasonable price. Then we would like to extend our stay in Florence about 2 weeks before staying dates. The price was almost 2 times. All hotels in Florence at that time were expensive. Fortunately, we were upgraded when checking in:-)  The hotel is in the good location- near train station and not very far from the interesting places. Good walking 55   The A/C or heater is not good. But we can open the window.

title: Very nice location, kind staff, best sleep experience!
review: The good. Friendly and helpful staff Nice rooms Good shower and bath Central location and close to main attractions Close to the railway and bus station  The less good Firm beds (we prefer softer ones) If you stay in early April and the weather is warm the rooms get hot because the air conditioning is not turned on till mid-April

title: Good location, excellent staff, and clean rooms
review: The hotel is in a good location, about 10 minutes walk from some of the main sites in Florence. Surrounded by few restaurants, nice pizza just across. Also close to one of the exits from the city so if you are driving, you won't get too much head ache. The rooms are well designed and the staff is very helpful. Also the breakfast is much better then in other places we have visited in Italy. The beds were super, best sleep during our vacation!

title: Great location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great location, close to everything.
review: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel last week. Booked through Voyage Prive we had an excellent deal.  The hotel is a short walk from the station and from all the main sights of the lovely city of Florence. The staff are very welcoming and efficient. Our room was a bit on the dark side with no view to speak of but given that we not in it very much that was not a particular issue. It was well laid out and comfortable; complimentary tea and coffee is available in rooms if you ask for it and there is a pillow menu which is brilliant!  The breakfast menu is adequate - although the bacon is rather over-cooked for our taste - and there is plenty to keep you going until lunch time!! Residents can get a two course evening meal with wine in the restaurant for 24 euros which is pretty…

title: Great location with modern amenities
review: We  stayed at the hotel for three nights and found the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable, very clean. There was plenty on offer for breakfast. We would totally recommend it for being close to attractions.

title: excellent hotel
review: My fiance and I ended up here after booking a hotel in central Florence and not being able to stand it. The Best Western was the only hotel with availability on such short notice and it turned out to be exactly what we needed. The room was large with a nice balcony. We used the hot tub to decompress after hours of touring the city. It was in close proximity to the Arno river and Oltrarno which we loved and was also in walking distance to the train station. The price tag was a bit more than we wanted to spend, but could have been due to booking last minute. Definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Ok hotel for the money
review: Very comfortable hotel located within walking distance of the historical center of Florence. Room was very clean, well appointed and the bed comfortable. Breakfast  buffet was generous. We found the staff informative and very friendly. We liked it so much that we stayed an extra night.

title: Gret location for good value
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Flashy, Expensive but Poor Facilities
review: Hotel located 3-5 minutes from train station, 10 minutes to the main attractions of Florence and a lot of nice Italian restaurants nearby. Rooms are quite big and beds comfortable. As for the bad things I didn't like the brakfast (not a big choice) and lack of WiFi was a big problem for me.

title: A good value hotel
review: Our room was ok and the location is pretty good but things like 'free' internet not working for several days; no access to tv, movies or even music videos; plumbing not up to standard; excessively hot in the room with no working thermostat; housekeeping removing personal belongings, all added up to poor value, and wouldn't stay here again.

title: Nice Hotel!
review: It's a very good value compared to those overpriced hotel in the city central. Locations is around 5 mins from the bus stop walk. The residents in the neighbourhood are helpful and i get lost with 3 different directions showed by the overkindhearted residents. Anyway breakfast was good, room is tidy and spacious. I enjoy my peaceful quiet stay.

title: A Good Stay
review: Very nice hotel with updated modern rooms and furniture.  The bathroom is also a good size with a full-size bathtub.  Great breakfast and the free wi-fi worked good.  The hotel is about a half-mile from the main attractions like the Duomo and Ponte Vecchio bridge, which isn't too bad.  There are some good restaurants nearby.  Overall, a great stay and would stay again for the right price.

title: Comfortable stay during holiday
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Good sized rooms,handy location.Walk to most shops,restaurants and attractions.
review: I have stayed in this hotel for 5 days. Generally speaking it is satisfactory. Perfect location, 10 mins walk from train station, 15 mins to main attractions, located in a small street so its relatively quite. Room is standard size, clean. There isn't slippers, or kettle in the room but you can ask for the receptionist and they will get them delivered to your room. Many restaurants, cafes, corner shops are within 5 mins walking distance. Good choice to stay.

title: Disappointing meals
review: We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed Florence immensely.This hotel is well positioned,close to restaurants,laundry and food shops.Walk easily from the hotel along the river to Pont Vecchio and then across to Duomo.Our room was clean,comfortable and of reasonable size.We have booked at the same hotel again this year in September,

title: Nic hotel and along a major road in Florence
review: We stayed here as part of a package. The rooms were very comfortable and clean with attractive furnishings. We also had use of a well equipped lecture room. The breakfast was very good, with a wide range of options, although we were all in agreement that the coffee was dreadful! Our evening meals were included as part of the package, but we were very disappointed with them. A starter one day was swimming in oil; the food was generally extremely salty and the desserts uninspiring. It is just ten minutes walk to the centre of Florence, which was a good plus point and we could here the bells of the Duomo chime, which was lovely, but there are several other hotels competing with it which are just as near, but with cheaper room rates, which we would seek out next time as independent…

title: Standard American chain
review: Clean and comfortable, located near many attractions and upscale shopping.  Quiet environment in hotel and service was excellent.  The room was clean, well appointed and had a good sized bathroom.  The shower partition on the tub was not as long as desired, which causes you to stand at the drain to not drench the floor.  And as in all European hotels, you must bring a washcloth or a "disposable" net scrubby to use.  The breakfast buffet was similar to all other hotels, however the coffee was decent.  Buffet includes sliced ham, bacon, cheeses and danishes, crusty rolls and fruit options, as well as juices.    All in all, a safe location, a clean environment and pleasant service. Would recommend.

title: Nice place close to the attractions
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Long weekend in Florence
review: Nice and calm Hotel, Close to the main attractions but really calm, nice and clean rooms, very nice breakfast terace and really good breakfast buffet, polite and helping waiters, we would choose it again for our next trip to Florence.

title: Great hotel in Florence
review: The hotel is well located and close to the central station and within walking distance to most of the famous attractions, restaurants and shops.The room is reasonably sized and modern, the only downside is the shower door not working very well and leaking, seems to be a common problem of Best Western hotel. The staff are very friendly and efficient except the waiting staff serving our breakfast, making cryptic remarks when we were asking for more tea!  Price wise it is certainly very competitive and value for money.

title: Quick Stay In Florence
review: Found this hotel on booking.com for a great price for bed and breakfast whilst looking for 2 double rooms. It is very easy to find from Santa Maria Novella and only a 5/10 minute walk. Friendly welcome and very easy check in. Our rooms were on floor 5, spotlessly clean, great size with a lovely view of the city looking out to the Duomo. Room was very warm when we arrived but able to turn heating off so much better then. Bathroom a good size with pink and blue towels, all good size and quality, with plenty of complimentary products. Bed really comfy, we both had 3 great nights sleep after miles of sightseeing all very easily accessible from here. Bar area had a happy hour each tea time and also remained open until around midnight. Special mention goes to Sergio who was just such…

title: Nice play to stay in Florence
review: Great location in the heart of Florence just a short walk from the train station. Easy access to most major sights. Stayed one night. The room was clean and pretty with adequate space for two people. The shower door/wall was a little short but the rest of the bathroom was good. Pretty good breakfast buffet with mostly European and American foods.

title: Nothing special
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great Location
review: A bit of a walk from the center of Florence so if you're traveling with children take this into consideration.  Rooms were small but adequate.  Hotels are generally expensive in Florence but this one seemed overpriced based on what was provided.

title: Modern Rooms- near river
review: Our first trip to Florence was full of good memories. We reserved the this hotel for three reasons: 1) good reviews, 2) great deal, 3) location and we were not disappointed in the slightest bit. What turned about a booking of 4 nights turned into 6 nights. The hotel main floor, lobby and common areas was clean but dates but the rooms were recently renovated in a modern / classic style and was very nicely done. The room and bathroom were a good size and everything was laid out to maximize the space. Breakfast was included and was good. The hotel staff throughout the hotel were very friendly and helpful especially with extending our staff and frequent chats about places of interests and recommendations on restaurants. Although it was on the northern part of the center, every place…

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: We (family four) stayed for two nights as part of a tour. The hotel is not much to look at from the street, but it is very clean and well maintained. We ate breakfast daily and the food was good, the dining room a good size with outdoor seating available. The rooms were modern enough with ample size. There were a few restaurants in the area to venture out if desired. The river is two blocks away and you can walk to downtown quite quickly along the river walk.

title: Very good location - some cons
review: We booked our trip to Italy via GATE1 Travel and the entire experience was sheer perfection.  The hotels were immaculate and with modern conveniences, even room service.  It was simply lovely.  I would like to thank the GATE1 TRAVEL folks and the Best Western Grand Hotel Adriatico.  If I were to ever go to Florence, Italy (which is a gorgeous city and FULL of history) on my own, I would book this hotel.  It's THAT nice.

title: Second stop on my Italian tour
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Enjoyable Stay at Adriatico
review: Florence was my second stop on my recent visit to Italy. This hotel was admittedly my least favorite, there was nothing particularly wrong with it; however my room was a bit worn and I was uncomfortable that there was a skylight directly over my head. It was in good repair and had neat controls to move shades and open it, however I have a few unreasonable fears.  The bathroom was more updated than the rest of the room and was large and beautiful with a double sick.  Breakfast was just okay, the bacon was incredibly salty, but the staff was incredibly attentive. All in all an okay stay and I'd stay again depending upon the price of other hotels in the area.

title: Only okay....
review: We had a Superior Double room on the top floor with a nice view of the city of Florence. The room was an excellent size (massive) with plenty of room and was very clean. The bathroom was big and spacious and plenty of storage room also.  The room was very hot though and the Air-con did not work but that would not stop me from visiting again as the location is superb and all amenities are so close by.   The staff were very helpful in everyway and would be there again very soon. Free Wifi as well was excellent.

title: Good location, pleasant stay...
review: I stayed for one night on business.   There is nothing specifically wrong with the Hotel, but just not for me.  Pros :  Room was spotlessly clean (Queen bed room, small but did not bother me)  Bathroom was clean with lots of good toiletries  Extra blanket available   (I was indeed cold and generally find Hotel rooms stiflingly hot in Italy)  Staff were pleasant  Location to train station good (I know Florence well and was on business, didn't need to be closer to tourist attractions.  Cons (for me personally)  Breakfast was average, very average.   White bread and canned fruit just don't cut it.   Rather have less variety and of better quality.  Kettle in room only available on request (I noticed this too late at night, so left it)  Room very outdated, wooden floors with mat next…

title: Excellent location only a block from the Arno River!
review: Initially we had booked in standard room and we upgraded ourselves to a suite since the standard rooms were too claustrophobic for 2 people. For the price and location you may overlook this though... Please use the bigger elevator by the side of the reception area. Lobby elevators are small. And they have parking.. though they take 25.00 Euro/day for that..

title: good hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Fabulous Firenze
review: We stayed at the Best Western Grand Hotel Adriatico at the beginning of October. This hotel was modern, comfortable, and clean. The staff was courteous and responsive. We enjoyed our stay here while in Florence and recommend this hotel.

title: Two blocks from the train station
review: Awesome Best Western in prime location. Walk to train, restaurants, and most tourist sights. The buffet breakfast was delicious and the choices were varied and  wonderful. The room was spacious, very clean, and the bed quite comfortable.

title: Solid 4-Star Hotel
review: Comfortable  hotel, the rooms are spacious and well appointed.  There is a nice restaurant in the hotel where we had dinner.  Excellent food, good value, 3 courses with wine and dessert for 28 Euros.  Breakfast was included and it has a good variety to suit most people.  Close to city centre and all the sights and museums in Florence.  I would stay here again.

title: Location...Location...Location
review: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Our room was located in the top floor (6th floor) and was very clean and quite spacious. The restaurant is located near to the train station and very close to the heart of Florence. Also, there is FREE WIFI in the whole hotel which was very convenient for us as students. Only two minuses: quite small & often crowded breakfast and rests of cigarettes outside of our window in the flower pot.   Very helpful staff- especially big thanks to Ms Rosaria! And all in all a very recommended hotel :).  We enjoyed our stay a lot!

title: Excellent stay!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great location
review: This was by far the best hotel we stayed at while in Italy for 2 weeks!  The room was quiet, spacious and well equipped, the staff were helpful, the breakfast was excellent, and the location was perfect as it was close to the train station and city central.  You can't go wrong with choosing this hotel if you are staying in Florence!

title: Not worth the money and definitly not 4 star
review: Located close to the train station and car rental made this hotel a great location for me. Museums,shopping and the Duomo close by it was perfect for my one night stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and spacious. Would stay at this hotel again.

title: Excellent staff, very average breakfast
review: Outdated rooms with shabby furniture. The whole hotel needs a rennovation to bring it up to modern day standards. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was good as main tourist areas were walking distance. I would rate this hotel as 2/3 star andnot 4

title: Conveniently located, well appointed
review: Room very comfortable and quiet (overlooking carpark). Unusual decoration but very clean. Wifi worked well through the hotel. Good location about 5 minutes walk from station, 2 from river and less than 15 to Uffizi etc. Reception excellent; we asked where they would recommend to eat the first night, they booked us a table when the restaurant opened later and phoned us up to give us the booking. Any other questions or requests were dealt with well. Breakfasts were disappointing, tinned tasteless fruit, bread and rolls a bit dry etc.

title: Surprisingly good stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice Hotel, Great Staff
review: I have to admit, "Best Western" made me nervous. In the U.S., I would never stay in a Best Western. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this hotel was nicer than any Best Western I have seen.The room was larger than expected.  Breakfast is included.The lobby needs updating. The upholstery appears ancient and was torture for my asthma.  The rooms, however, had no carpeting. They were clean and quiet.

title: Perfect
review: Many thanks for your kind review, we are happy to read that we surprised you. Hoping to welcome you again please accept our best regards.    Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Great Hotel
review: We just spent a week here, and found it to be the right hotel in the right place! Rooms are nice, breakfast was good, (great cappuccino), location was good once you get to know the place,  but what  makes it for us is always the staff. They did their best to feed us, get us drinks, and best of all find the right tours for us no matter how long it took. I wish we could remember her name, but she is almost middle aged with reddish shoulder lenght hair. We kept asking her for help, and she was always so patient and supportive.  She was a great help. We would recommend the Adriatico for sure. Larry & Janet W  Canada

title: Average hotel in a great position
review: Thanks a lot for this nice review which is really important for us: also Ms Rosaria, the helpful lady at the reception thaks you for the nice words spent. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.   Daniele Benelli     Assistant Manager

title: A Kiwi 's Experience
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great location, very clean
review: We were Free Independent Travellers (fits) mad enough to drive in Florence. Even our GPS found it hard to find this hotel which doesn't look much from the outside, but has a bit of style once inside. This hotel has it's own secure compound for parking your vehicle but it comes at €20 per day for a car!  Our room was big enough and clean, and towels were changed every day. We found the air conditioning a bit loud and on opening the external window for some air, an alarm was set off notifying management who rang our room to politely ask us to shut the window. The trick is to turn the unit off completely ....then open your window, actually it is quiet outside at night. Breakfast was very good in the form of a very varied buffet . Top marks here. Our best memory of the Best Western…

title: Lower than expectations
review: At first a big hallo to Auckland and to the entire New Zeland, really a beutifull country. Many thanks for your wonderful and complete review which is really important for us and we love when our Clients enjoyed our hotel and all our services. Hoping to welcome you again here at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.   Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager NB No problem, My Tour refund us....

title: Best Western but Worst Food
review: We had a great stay here just on the edge of the city.  We found the location to be very convenient and the rooms very clean.  The air conditioning worked wonderfully and didn't shut off when you left the room.  Breakfast was decent but more variety would be nice.  Attentive and knowledgeable staff.  Decent size grocery store only steps away.  Would stay here again.

title: Spacious room & great location!!!
review: Many thanks for this nice and complete review which is really important for us; we are very proud when we receive comments like your. Hoping to welcome again at the Grand Hotel Adriatico, please accept our best regards.    Daniele Benelli    Assistant Manager

title: Good value for money
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace.
