title: Chosen by airline staff
review: We just returned back home from our 2 1/2 week vacation throughout Italy and so happy we selected this hotel for our 2 days in Firenze.  Not only was it a good location near the train station but our was room spacious, ultra clean, nice sized modern bathroom with some nice ammenities like a pants press, etc. All the people working at the reception desk were so accomodating and offered to help with directions, dining choices and assistance with museum entrances, etc. They offered fruit and beverages in the latter part of the afternoon and just made you feel very welcome and at home.  We loved Firenze and can't wait to come back again sometime soon.

title: Good Location
review: Reasonably new or newly refurbished hotel. Well positioned for walks to the city and to the river. Reception staff were amazing ..especially Leonard and Rosanne who organized our coach trip to the vineyards and to Pisa. Excellent breakfast selection.

title: Clean hotel, location is fine
review: We have been travelling for three weeks - Spain, France, Italy. Booked five hotels in advance, of which four were 3 star and one was 4 star (Grand Hotel Adriatico). The hotel was located in a very central location in Florence and was in easy walking distance to all sights. The room was attractive and generally clean, but dusty when we first arrived. The shower was the worst of any on our trip. Water would always flow onto the bathroom floor. Breakfast was fair but not exceptional. All of our 3 star hotels provided free WiFi but not the Grand Hotel Adriatico. Not only did they not have WiFi, but they charged us for internet access (5 Euro for 40 minutes, 10 Euro for 80 minutes, 12 Euro for 24 hours). Honestly, for the price, I'd keep searching for other hotels in Florence.

title: Good hotel - North American style with Tuscan accents
review: We stayed at the Best Western in Florence for 4 nights.    The rooms were very spacious and had all the amenities of modern day life - flat screen, WiFi etc.  It was kept very clean.  The location was ok - meaning it was close enough to the main Piazza (about a 10 minute walk) but there was some shadi people hanging around the doors day and night.  There is an internet cafe beside the hotel and I guess they hang around there.  They never bothered us - just made me feel a bit uncomfortable.  The hotel shuts it's main doors around 1am - so you have to buzz to be let in.  This made us feel better.  The staff was friendly.  They tried to accomodate me when I told them the bed was too hard.  Although they switched my mattress - we found most beds in Italy too hard.  There was parking…

title: clean, modern hotel well-located in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great location and friendly staff
review: this is a Best Western hotel and was the most American of the hotels we stayed at in our recent trip to Paris and Italy.  It was also the most expensive but had many amenities.  Rooms were spacious, clean, and very well-decorated in a Tuscan theme. Laminate hardwood floors looked lovely but the downside was that one could hear chairs scraping on the floor of the room above which in our case was relatively early in the morning.  Lovely breakfast and happy hour in the bar from 5 - 7 pm.  20 minute walk to the Duomo and the Uffizi gallery so very central.  5 to 10 minute walk to the train station, and 2 blocks to the Arno river.    Service was sometimes very good, sometimes less so dependent on who one asked for assistance at the reception desk.  Service was very attentive and…

title: Standard 4 star hotel
review: Nice hotel with great position. All the the attractions in walking distance.  Good choice for breakfast, nice clean rooms and very friendly staff.  Would recommend to anyone.

title: Nice hotel near train station
review: Stayed there for 2 nights. Has all that you would be expect from a 4 star hotel, neat and clean, standard services. On the day of arrival, had an issue with dripping heating rods but was happy to see it fixed in 10 mins of being reported. Decently sized bathroom but average size room.  Dinner at the hotel resturant was ok. Standard compliementary breafast. Only shortcoming was that this hotel lacked the Florentine touch in its furniture and decor and was a standard 4-star hotel...

title: A fine facility, good staff, good location
review: We were in Florence for a night and we needed a place near the train station to catch an early trip to Venice. We booked grand hotel adriatico for this reason and we were not wrong in our choice.  The hotel is only about five minutes walking from the station. The direction given by the hotel when we booked is accurate. I love the modern decor of the room which seemed like newly renovated. Although the room is not big compared to American standards, it was spacious enough for two people. I would have loved if they provided a dental kit as we expect from a chain like best western, there was none. It seems that this is now the trend in almost all hotels in Europe in the 3 to 4 * categories. In our almost three week travel in Europe staying in seven hotels, only one hotel in Izmir…

title: A good value for the quality.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Italian fawlty towers.
review: We stayed at this hotel from 4/9/12-4/13/12. The room was very clean, comfortable, and well decorated though not very spacious, as expected. The staffs are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is a good start with a choice of cafe Americano, Espressos, or cappuccinos. It's a full breakfast in a nice dinning room setting to get your day started. The hotel is located 2 long blocks from the termini so taxi is not required, and it's about 15 minutes walk to Ponte Vecchio. A liitle away from the main scenes but can be a bonus at times. The neighborhood at night is a different story. There seems to be quite a bite of squanderers in the area after 8 but we didn't feel threaten by them though it might not feel comforting strolling around after dinner. I would recommend this hotel for…

title: Excellent hotel!
review: Myself and 14 year old son stayed here for a few days, as Florence was somewhere I always wanted to come, and ideal for a history hungry teenager who's appetite for Florence was awakened by an Xbox game called assasins creed.  We arrived late ish , about 12 am. The room was stiflingly hot, but we were told no air con until April 15th, so Windows were flung open all night.ALso, we had to request a kettle and coffee every night.  They took them away everyday and didn't replace them.After asking for the hot drink equipment, it would take on average an hour and a half to arrive.  Breakfasts were fine, and the room clean and comfortable.  The,location of the hotel was,very convenient, and only about a mile from the Duomo. I had made a booking with British airways for flight and hotel…

title: An old hotel keeping up with good standards
review: I can think of nothing at all to say against this hotel.  the room was lovely, so was the breakfast.  The receptionists are helpful, as are all the staff.  Also it is in a really good location, minutes away from the river, and 15-20 minutes from the Ponte Vecchio,the Uffizi and the Duomo. Definitely recommended!

title: Great hotel
review: The Grand Hotel Adriatico in Florence was established in the late 50's as a  good 4 star hotel  and it has kept those standards since than.  The location is about 5 minutes from S. Maria Novella rail station and 10 minutes from the centre.  There are many hotels around this area of the same grade but none of them are as confortable,clean ,professional and above all good value for money as the Grand Hotel Adriatico.  I have to say  BEST WESTERN have done an excellent job with some of their hotels in Florence much better than some of their hotels in the UK.

title: Deservedly 4 star
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Welcoming Hotel
review: Very cclean, with nice and spacious lounge. Nice room. Only gripe is that there is now a charge for the parking on site, which used to be included in the price and that the street where the hotel is situated, became seedy.  J Fisher England

title: Adriatico OK
review: The Hotel was a good base for a 5 day trip to Florence.  Comfortable rooms in a quiet hotel.  Staff were helpful and had a good command of English.  Breakfast was adequate with a good selection of foods on offer.

title: A perfect choice for your stay in Florence
review: Clean, neat, rooms comfortable, no big deal. Breakfast typical, waitstaff a bit stiff. BEWARE-at night Via Palazzuola (just up from hotel and a walkway to more central locations) has become a drunk hangout. Many immigrants apparently like to meet on the street or at a "Club". Carabinieri were stationed at intersection until about 7PM. Suspect hotel will have problems if issues not resolved. Area seems to have become a bit "seedy".

title: Hotel situated in Florence close to river and SMN station & has a secure car park adjoining
review: You will find all the conveniences of a 4 stars hotel, in a very central location, you are within 15 min walk from most tourist attractions in Florence; a nice surprise - hotel's private parking. Rooms extremely clean, spacious bathroom, friendly staff (well, mostly), great breakfast. I can think of only 2 minuses: internet access is very expensive and not many options, and per pay TV was not working, though it was advertised.

title: Good location/nice rooms, missing some amenities
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very Average 3* Hotel in Exceptional and Unique City
review: The hotel was visually lovely. The staff was very attentive and helpful. Rooms were a nice size and had a Tuscan feel. Location was good, within walking distance to the city center. The beds were rather firm, so be prepared for that. There was no Wi-Fi in the rooms and you have to pay for it ($10 Euro for 1 hour).

title: good experience
review: Stayed twice in Grand Hotel Adriatico during August last year. Chose the property for the combination of relatively "reasonable" price and close proximity to the centre of Florence and Railway station. Have to admit that I am a bit surprised with the chain of positive reviews which seem to overpraise this hotel. Will try to explain why: Positives first and there is in my view only one really-good location, only 3-5 mins walking from train station. Very convenient as many tourists (if not the majority) arrive to the city from Pisa. It's also very close to Arno river (1min) with a very pleasant walk along river banks to the famous Ponte Vecchio and central Florence (approx 10 mins) Negatives-for any traveller, even not much experienced it will become clear very quickly it's NOT a…

title: Great hotel and great value
review: This was a 4 star hotel but was not as good as the other Best Western  hotels we had stayed in rated 3 stars. The staff was helpful but russhed. No internet and parking was 20e per day.

title: Quiet and clean hotel near train station
review: Less than a 5 minute walk from Santa Maria Novella train station on the west side of the city center.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Full breakfast provided and there is outdoor garden terrace where you can eat your breakfast which is lovely.  Wi-Fi is offered for a fee.  Walking distance to key attractions, restaurants and bars.  Highly recommend it.

title: Great little hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Superb - Best Hotel in Florence
review: This hotel is a short walk from the Florence SM rail station. While their website makes it look small and quirky as are so many BWs, this one had the most impressive lobby I've seen and the floors in the rooms were wood in great condition, not tile or carpet.  I was extremely impressed with the overall cleanliness and condition of both the rooms and the bathrooms (we had 2 rooms for 2 days). Not much in the way of views from the rooms, and the internet wasn't free, but breakfast was.  This hotel is about halfway between the train station and the river, and while it isn't the closest to the Uffizi and the other sites, they are only a modest walk away.  Also...Just around the corner is the restaurant Peperoncino which does a killer steak florentine and pasta with truffle sauce.…

title: typical American chain
review: This Hotel is very easily accessible from the station at Florence. It is about an easy 10 minute walk and the way is flat. The Hotel is very clean and there is a lovely atmosphere, created by the very friendly and attentive staff. All the usual attractions are close by, the musuems, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio, etc. The breakfast is very good, self service and lovely cappuccino, with a nice selection . The rooms are very comfortable and there is a nice courtyard at the back of the Hotel where you can take the sun or just relax. All in all a very classy Hotel and well worth another visit.

title: Great location. Stunning view!
review: About 5-minutes by foot from SMN Station.  The hotel itself is nice but the location is a bit questionable because we did not feel comfortable passing by certain portions of the street where interesting characters seem to be loitering around at night.  Their breakfast buffet was great... they have scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, and toasted bread for crying out loud!  woohoo!!!  They also have different cold cuts and cheeses, yogurt, pastries, fresh fruit, and more.  Front desk personnel were okay.

title: Comfortable and excellent service
review: It is quite close to the train station and the bus terminal. When we arrived it was dark and we had to walk through a busy but dark small lane. There were quite a few people at several eateries. We were not very sure of the venue at the first sight, later we realised that there are quite a good range of restaurants and cafes nearby.  The staff had been helpful and polite. We were given a map upon arrival. We were been given a room on the top floor 7 with a stunning view of the historic centre. We could see the Duomo and several cathedrals and the famous red-top roof of Florence without problems.  We guess the hotel was the tallest building within the neighbourhood. It is about 15 minute's walk to the historic centre. DO WEAR FLAT SHOES as the medieval roads may not been kind to…

title: decent location for  good quality
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Good value for money
review: Stayed there for 3 nights. Not the best location but a fair price. Walking distance to everything we wanted to see. 5 minute walking distance from the Florence train station. Rooms were reasonably in size, quiet and VERY clean. Staff was very willing to help. Breakfast was good with a nice selection. Wait staff were all well trained and accommodating. There was internet in all the rooms but no free WIFI hot spot for your smart phones.   We booked through a travel agent and spend another 7 days at a Tuscany winery.

title: 15 walk to the all attractions
review: We had a very quiet room at the back side of the hotel (overlooking the parking lot). The matress was very hard, which was ok for us, but maybe is not for everyone. Well located (10min walk to the dome, 10min walk from the train station Firenze SMN and just around the corner of most city car rental agencies) with clean and spacy rooms. Breakfast was not a big deal, it offered a basic selection of typical continental breakfast. Internet is available in the room (cable, but didn't check for wireless) and at a kiosk in the lobby for EUR 5 per half an hour!  Car parking is offered also but charged EUR 20 per day (was for free before 01/01/2011).  Overall the stay was very ok for us but we stayed only for one night and the location of the hotel served perfectly our needs (arriving by…

title: Comforts of Home in Florence
review: Short walk (about 3 blocks) from the train station, the entrance into the Adriatico was wonderful. Unfortunately, the area is rather seedy. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. In room safe and hairdryer and a heated towel rod just made it even better. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet and clean. I must say though, that the cost of internet service was very high. I found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful in the day time week days, incompetent in the evenings and weekends, even the manager. We arrived at the hotel about 10 p.m and asked about the tickets for the art galleries and the person on the front desk could not help us at all, we did ask again about the tickets in the morning and we got them right away on the front desk. Breakfast was very…

title: Disappointed
review: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Adriatico in March 2011.  We booked this hotel through a travel package and were expecting a budget hotel with few amenities.  Compared to our hotels in Rome and Venice, this hotel was by far the largest and most modern hotel we stayed at during our vacation in Italy.   The hotel is located close to the train station within easy walking distance to the river and all major attractions.  The location could not have been more convenient for us.  The service was exceptional.  There was no language barrier.  We had a problem with our room safe (our mistake), and the staff was quick to come to our rescue.  The rooms were large, clean, and comfortable.  The breakfast here was the best we had during our vacation.  There was a very large assortment of foods,…

title: Tiny tiny room !
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: WORST customer service ever!
review: Best Western Adriatico near the central station in Florence.. a 10-15 min walk to the old part of town.   Pros :  -renovated rooms -location near river and central station  Cons: - rooms are tiny !! actually only space for the bed... and i even had a double room..  - internet rates are outrageous !! 15 € and only via cable in room ! - Breakfast is expensive and not very nice... (6,50 € extra for breakfast in room) - night shift guy alway unfriendly and not very helpful !!  Go somewhere else in Florence !!

title: If I had a do-over, definitely would try something else.
review: My husband and I booked our honeymoon trip to Italy (Venice/Florence/Rome/Naples/Sorrento) using  Best Western points through a BW hotel reservation service. We thought everthing was ok until we were about to check out from the Venice BW hotel  that BW points weren't transferred to pay for the hotel stay. We were charged with EUROs. We explained our situation to the manager of the hotel that we paid the hotel stay with the BW points.  He made a couple of phone calls and he took care of it immediately. We were stressed out  but very satisfied with the customer service.   BW hotel reservation customer service rep has booked us using regular rate---paying with euros,not with the points.They've informed us that the points will be  applied to all the hotel stays in Italy. Then, the…

title: Pretty nice
review: We booked this hotel while still in Canada using their 1.800 number. We had done this for Rome stay as well so we thought that the hotel would be just as good. It actually made us realise that what we had in Rome was excellent. The rooms are extremely dark, depressing feel. The staff, if they understand you seem to be nice but are completely incompetant; they never gave us correct information once (and no we are not loud and obnoxious). We had a few problems we the room, the lights would not stay on, needed cardboard shoved into the card stow, the bathtub/shower leaked. When I had read previous reviews and people had complained I thought that they must be overweight and a little daft not to understand how to use a shower head in one hand and lather in the other; I was wrong. The…

title: good hotel close to center
review: Dear Sirs,  we thank you for your observations regarding our hotel. This give us the opportunity to improve ourselves and clarify some points that could be only missunderstandings. Let’s start from the rooms: Our rooms work with a keycard that operates (while the card is in the slot, inside the room) electricity and security. It is a way for energy saving and it guarantees security for our clients. The feelings that our room’s style, our colours and furnishing give to the client are extremely personal. Someone find our rooms very relaxing, others find them too bright. The mattresses for some people are too hard, but, we understand, that for you were too soft.  In any case if you found your room not so comfortable as you expected, applying to the reception, we would have been very happy to help you and to satisfy your expectations moving into another room. The staff: All our staff speaks fluent english, and we always try to do our best in order to make our client’s stay pleasant. Last by not least the restaurant: Our OPERA restaurant is open everyday from 7.30 p.m to 10.30 p.m (closed only on sunday). The opening time is written in our directory in all our rooms and, also, at the entrance of the restaurant. There were no extra closing dates in the period of you stay in our hotel, therefore we really do not understand why you said you “always” found it closed. We hope that we will be able to welcome you again in our hotel. Best regards Paolo Guidotti Front Office Manager

title: Comfy hotel, convenient to train and city
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Had my doubts about a Best Western
review: We travelled by train to and from Florence and was looking for a hotel  that wasn't too far from the train station. This hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good. Next time I may look for something a little closer to the centre of Florence, but this hotel was great value for money and very convenient to the train for us.

title: Lovely hotel.
review: Alora, my friends and I were part of a Gate1 Travel tour (I hightly recommend them especially our guide Vanni Martelli) from September 21-28.  We were celebrating our 50th birthday.  We stayed in three different hotels and the Grand Hotel  Adriatico in Florence was the best. Not being an extensive traveler, I had reservations (no pun intended) about staying in a Best Western in Italy.  Service:  We were able to check in with no problems.  The front desk staff spoke excellent english.  One of my friends misplaced her keycard and when she went to the front desk to get a replacement it was done in a matter of  minutes without hassle.  Breakfast was served buffet style each morning and the staff was quick in providing you with a good morning, a cup of their excellent coffee and warm…

title: First visit to Florence
review: We had a 2 night stay in this hotel whilst visiting Florence.  We found the hotel well situated for walking into the centre.  There was  an enclosed, safe car park for our car (the main reason for choosing the hotel) as we had no intention of driving in the city which was very welcome. The room was spotless and more luxurious than what we are used to, but it was worth the extra we paid. The staff were exceedingly helpful. The breakfast was excellent. I really have nothing negative to say about the Adriatico!

title: A good stay
review: We wanted a 4 star hotel easy 10minute walk to city centre, and the Adriatico provided us with such a location, convenient to walk into centre along the river side or via shops/restaurants. The location is excellent for main train service should one wish to visit other cities, and the main bus/tram services are also close by. The hotel was quiet, clean, with extremely friendly and helpful staff available at all times to assist.The only thing missing from the room was perhaps the facility to make a tea/coffee. The breakfast for all tastes with a good choice of serials ,fruit, cold meats, cheeses, pastries, along with some warm options. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would have no hesitation to return, as the hotel and location met all our needs.

title: Good hotel shame about the location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: One of our favourite hotels in Europe.
review: Found the service acceptable but you need to ask for what you want then help is offered. There was a problem one night when some younger guests were knocking on doors disturbing other guests Management let the culprits stay on instead of asking them to leave.  Rooms very good and the cleaners were excellent, but a bit short on storage for clothes if stay is over four days.  Breakfast was adequate usual cooked and continental foods and service good for hot drinks.  Location is a let down as this part is quite run down and a bit rowdy around the streets near hotel the police were called out two times during our stay to deal with problems. My partner did not like having to walk through certain streets leading to the hotel so we found a safer route. The hotel Restaraunt was poor we…

title: Great value and good quality
review: We have stayed at the Adriatico several times in the past few years and we always look forward to returning. The location is not great but it's within easy reach of the town and the railway station, SMN. Our favourite restaurant Marione, which we also recommend, is only a short walk away. The walk into town along by the river on a sunny morning is stunning. The hotel is very clean, stylish and modern whilst retaining a classical old world charm and elegance. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We may have inadvertently upset the lady who kept our room so wonderefully spick and span, arranging everything thing and keeping us tidy, when we sought her out to show our appriciation, in the time honoured way, she probably thought initially that we were compaining; she spoke no…

title: Great base for exploring Florence .....
review: With this being our first trip to Florence we chose the "safe" option of Best Western and good Trip Advisor reviews; we weren't disappointed. A key additional factor was that we were driving, so secure parking was a must and the fact that it was free was a real bonus. The overall quality of service, facilities, position and price really couldn't be beaten. Other reviews mentioned the slightly down at heel immediate surroundings but don't be put off by that; for the 5/10 min walk to the central area around Piazza Republicca we felt perfectly safe. The staff were very effiicient and answered all queries about the hotel or the city most effectively. To pay under €100 per night for Bed & Breakfast for this quality of offering represents very good value. No hesitation in recommending…

title: Very comfortable hotel in centrally located area
review: My husband and I visited  Italy last year and spent a couple of days in Florence.  We enjoyed the city so much we decided to take a slightly longer break to appreciate this beautiful city a little more, and trust me when I say it was worth every penny.  Although it took us two flights to get there, and we had to travel for approximately 8 hours (2 x 2 hour flights plus 4 hours between flights), when we arrived the staff could not have made us feel more welcome.  We had requested a top floor room (less chance of disturbance from noise) and was very pleased with the room we were allocated.  The room was very clean and spacious with a flat screen tv and plenty of drawer and cupboard space with a safe at no extra charge (what a change from the usual).  We went down to the reception…

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great value, very nice hotel, good location
review: We had a double connecting room. One for my husband and I and one for our 2 teenagers. We had alot of room for 2 nights. The staff was friendly and very helpful. They helped us plan a trip to Pisa and gave us some good restaurants to eat at. The area around the hotel is not the best but we felt safe. The free breakfast was very good and filling. The staff went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one.

title: Excellent Place to Stay
review: I traveled with my daughter, and a group from her university, to Italy for 8 days. We had three nights in Florence and were very pleased with the Hotel Adriatico.  My concerns while traveling are always safety, cleanliness, and (hopefully) value. Having traveled a bit in my 50 years I was not the least bit concerned with the location as have been a concern to some others. This is just a few blocks off the busier streets...just minutes from the train station (our usual mode of transportation), close to restaurants (a nice little place just across the street), and in a great location to visit much of Florence. The lobby was well lit, quaint, and comfortable. This hotel is not trying to pass itself off based on it's appearance and decor but it goes a long way for what it offers in…

title: Wow, excellent staff.
review: I was glad I choose this hotel after nightmares places in London and Rome. The staffs are friendly and knowleadgeable. Great room with good breakfast in the morning. Location is awesome, basically 20 minutes walk from central attraction. I would definitely come back to this hotel. Many restaurants and internet cafe nearby. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

title: Nothing special
review: What a contrast from Rome! This Adriatico Firenze has Polite, helpful staff, personal coffee service at bkfst, immediate and positive response to problems, good bar in the evening to relax. Great location near the River Arno, spacious lobby. good quiet rooms. The hotel restaurant had a limited menu, but lots of good restaurants nearby.

title: Good value away from the noise
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Good value hotel in Florence
review: Most of the tourist hotels are towards the market stretch which can be noisy. This is a quieter hotel away from the more touristy stretch. It is still in a convenient location which is just one street away from the bus/train station and on the other end, one street away from the river. This convenience allows you to pop by the river to enjoy sunsets which can be spectacular.  We found the hotel decor at the lobby to be dated but the room decor is relatively new while trying to retain an old world feel. This is unique from the usual modern decor seen in other hotels.  Nothing to complain about as its a clean and comfortable hotel for the price. Service was ok, nothing out of this world. We didn't drive but we saw ample parking lots for those with cars. Near the hotel are various…

title: Comfortable hotel with secure parking in Firenze
review: Just back from a 5 night stay at the Grand Hotel Adriatico.  We felt that this hotel offered very good value for money.  It was spotlessly clean with bedding changed daily. The room was a good size and recently refurbished so in very good decorative order.  Breakfast, although not the best choice, was adequate and the waiters were excellent, could not fault them.  Unfortunately we did not read the information in our room and found out too late that we could have had tea making facilities in our room if we had asked. In terms of location, it is a very short walk from the station.  This not only made it convenient for arriving and departing but  also  for the day trips we took by bus to Lucca and Siena. If you are looking to do these day trips, be aware that there are 2 bus…

title: Not your typical Best Western
review: We have been staying here for at least 5 years. The rooms, although not large, are well-equipped and our superior room had a small balcony with table/chairs and a superb shower. The beds are comfortable and we obtained excellent feather pillows on request. The car park is secure which is very important if you are driving and it is close to Santa Maria Novella Church and the station. The food is ok but not wonderful and could be improved. Plenty of small restaurants close by and the river is very close.

title: Free parking, lovely hotel and easy walking distance to local sites
review: What a pleasant place to stay in Florence.  I know, you're probably thinking why would you stay in a Best Western in Italy.  Here are some of the reasons - comfort, cleanliness, location, great staff, immaculate rooms, but, most of all, you know what you're getting.  After having had one REALLY bad hotel experience in Florence, this hotel is a breath of fresh air.  Without a doubt this is where I'll always stay when I'm in Florence.

title: Great service, quality for a price
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Easy parking. No frills - fair value.
review: My wife and I planned an anniversary trip to Florence and wanted a bit of no nonsense luxury.  We got this.  The hotel is easy to find from the bus terminus - we got the bus from the airport.  The staff speak English and were friendly.  I had asked for a room with a double bed and a balcony and we got that.  The room was small - as is usually the case with European rooms.  It was quiet, the air conditioning worked fine although a little noisy.  Breakfast was good - plenty of it and high quality European, that is meats and cheeses.  Some bacon and scrambled eggs but we avoided these and had selection of fruits, cakes and aforementioned meats and cheeses.  We had to ask for a kettle and tea / coffee but they were eager to supply it.  It is a ten minute walk to the centre and…

title: Nice hotel, clean, undesireable location
review: I chose this hotel for value and convenience on a one-night business trip to Florence. If you get a good deal and want a cheap, clean and reliable hotel in the city centre, this is the choice for you. As you will see from my other Florence review (of Grand Hotel St. Maria Novella), I have a clear favorite in this city.   Free and available parking in the backyard is a great advantage if you’re just passing by Florence with a car.

title: It is a good hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. This hotel is nice and very close to the Arno river. It's 10 minutes to walk to the Ponte Vecchio (you can walk along side the Arno river). The beds are hard to sleep in. The shower doesn't have a curtain to close while showering, but a small plastic covering (water tends to splash on the flower). The front desk staff was helpful to some extent (some individuals). There was one front desk staff (short man with curly hair) who is very sarcastic and responds to questions in a manner as though he's bothered; this makes one uncomfortable to ask ANYTHING at all. I have traveled to Italy several times, therefore I am somewhat seasoned and not the first time tourist...this staff member could insult anyone from his behavior. All in all, everyone…

title: Good hotel with parking
review: Nothing wrong with a stay here. Great location for driving to, not to difficult if you follow their directions. The car park is small, we arrived late so it was full, but they have a deal with a garage around the corner for €20 a day - not bad for Florence and pretty hassle free. The location is great for sight seeing, short walk to all the major attractions and the river. We travelled with our young baby, so wernt out late, its a city centre location but we never felt anything but at ease. So to the Hotel, I was a bit worried as we email to confirm a babys cot bed but got no reply, but when we arrived everything was ready for us to our relief. I know its said in most other reviews(which I did not beleive) but the staff were really excellent, I really have to stress that. The…

title: Recommended
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: EXCELLENT HOTEL WOULD STAY AGAIN
review: Good location and easy to find, particularly if travelling by train. Needed to stay two extra days (volcanic ash problems) and staff were most helpful. Hotel is well decorated and clean, but breakfast is average. Rooms are stylish and quiet. No complaints. Would stay again - a good choice, especially at the right price.

title: Good hotel
review: We were 4 couples travelling for a long weekend to Florence & Pisa. We selected Grand Hotel Adriatico as it was close to the railway & coach stations in addition to Best Western being a good brand name, photos looked good & other reviews favourable. The reception staff were very friendly & professional, all our rooms were ready on arrival and check in was easy & prompt. All our rooms were next to each other on same floor, which we liked.  We enjoyed drinks & snacks in the bar during the afternoon. Service was excellent.  Directions on hotel website were accurate and it was easy to get around Florence from the hotel. There was a market outside the hotel on Saturday. There are lots of bars & restaurants in the area.  Breakfast was good and plentiful.

title: Nice hotel, and nice location
review: This hotel was a very good surprise. Rates are good, rooms are clean, friendly staff, free parking (but pay attention to the fact that this one is quite small), good breakfast. The location is fine; 10 minutes walk from the duomo/shopping area. I plan to go back to Florence and will definitely stay in this hotel.

title: Wonderful Room, Wonderful Staff, Wonderful Location!
review: One of the best things about this hotel was it's location.  Just a very short walk (5 mins)from the train station and allows for a nice walk to all of the major sites within the central part of the city.  The hotel itself was nice and clean, and the staff were friendly.   I wouldn't say anything really put this hotel over the top, it was just a nice average hotel.  The room was clean and fairly comfortable.  There are a few nice restaurants in the area, and one that we ate ate a couple times was just across the street and was very nice.  you will have a nice stay at this hotel but it probably wont blow you away.

title: Great !
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good value
review: A great Hotel, at 10 minutes from the Duomo in the city center. A good 4 stars hotel. Excellent breakfast, full of choice (bread, juice, cereal, etc) and a very remarkable service. The rooms are comfortable.  And the top, is of course the free parking in the Hotel (if there is still a place - careful in summer). This free parking in Florence motivated are choice.

title: A relaxing end to a stressful journey
review: Good and comfortable hotel in a quiet location, only 10 minutes walking from the railway station Firenze Santa Maria Novella. Breakfast buffet was fine and the room was quite big and clean, but with old furniture. Maybe a little overpriced.

title: Extermely good value
review: The decision to stay at the Grand Hotel Adriatico was a last minute one thanks to accomodation with friends being a little cramped to say the least. The hotel was next door to where we should have been saying and was literally the first one we tried.  We're so glad we did.  A stunning lobby met by both kind hearted and professional check in staff who offered us two free drinks at the bar on arrival and directed us to our room.  We were on the 5th floor in a standard room and all I can say is I would like to see the executive rooms. The room was spotless throughout and featured tuscan terracotta walls, a widescreen LCD TV on the wall, a large king size bed, mini bar, work area etc. The bathroom again was spotless with an entertainment system in the bedroom.  The breakfast was of…

title: I had a great rate - under 100 Euro per night
review: We stayed 3 nights.  The room was attractive & well appointed. The location is within walking distance of many attractions. The staff was very helpful.  The food at the restaurant was quite good.  The breakfast buffet was the best we had on the entire trip-very extensive.

title: Delightful Stay!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Loved Grand Hotel Adriatico
review: We stayed here for 3 nights during our trip around Italy.  We were impressed with the cleanliness and comfort of our room, the helpfulness of the staff, and the onsite parking.  We walked everywhere in the city, and found this to be a fairly central location to most sights.  The breakfast was more than adequate for us.  Fresh juice, fresh fruit, meats and cheeses, eggs.... great way to start the day.  There is a restaurant on site, but we never saw it open.  There is a restaurant across the street, Maso, that is wonderful.  We had dinner there two different nights.  We would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Firenze!

title: Great Hotel for the price
review: We booked this trip by travel agency and were very positively surprised by the high standard of this Hotel. Although situated in the surroundings of the main station the room, facing a back yard,  was very quiet. The staff very friendly and competent. Altogether, we had a very pleasant stay and hope to come back some time later again.

title: Not excellent but a very good hotel.
review: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for five nights. The staff is professional, friendly and extremely attentive. We stayed in a suite which was nice. My bed and couch were a little hard for our taste. Also, the floor was hardwood  which proved to be quite annoying whenever the guest upstairs walked or moved chairs. My suggestion to the manager is to replace the  hardwood with rugs.  The breakfast buffet which was included with the room price is terrific overall. The buffet offered a variety of fruits, pastries, yogurts, juices, cereals and hot items. However, the scrambled eggs were a little soggy for my taste and the bacon slightly undercooked.  We attempted to dine the first night however, the restaurant closed an hour early.  This was a disappointment. After that we ate…

title: Cozy hotel in Firenze
review: This is a reasonably priced hotel, with spacious and clean rooms and a nice backyard for breakfast. Not exactly cosy, as it is a big hotel but still staf are helpful. It is located very close to the main railway station but about 20 minutes walk from th emain city attractions. However, it is next door to Borgo Ognissanti, a street with all kinds of amenities and shops.

title: Very clean rooms, nice location.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Grand Hotel Adriatico-very nice, great location
review: This hotel was extremely clean, and the rooms were good-sized for Europe.  Large bathroom, also, with nice-sized tub.  We stayed there for 3 nights.  It was a fair value, also, for Florence.  The hotel is a very convenient walk from the train station, perhaps 7-8 minutes with luggage.  A few shops and convenience stores are very close.  You will need to take a bus to the heart of Florence, however, or do some serious walking, as we did. The breakfast was very good with lots of variety, and the waiters were very friendly and helpful. The only 2 things that we could fault were: 1.  the service at the front desk, which was adequate, but the clerks were not very talkative.  Also, an email re: something that I lost  was not answered, which I thought was not very good for repeat…

title: Good choice for good money
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights before we took a mediterranean cruise.  This hotel was selected because of it's close proximity to the train station, it's good price, and the others reviews on trip advisor.  My husband and I were very happy with this hotel.  It was clean and the staff was helpful and friendly.  The room was a decent size, for an Italian hotel, and very updated and modern looking.  A great plus was the fabulous breakfast that was included in the price.  It was a wonderful spread with a lot of food and great choices for all tastes.  The staff not only offered coffee and tea, but delicious cappachino too.  There was also a pretty outside gazebo area to eat your breakfast if you preferred to be outside.  The staff also recommended some restaurants…

title: Nice hotel, the area was less than touristy.
review: We stayed in the Adriatico hotel for 2 nights when travelling through Tuscany in July this year. Hotel itself is ok, rooms were clean, bathroom was very nice, clean and big enough. Our room was situated on the 6th floor with windows to the yard. We appreciated free parking in the hotel yard (approx. 25 parking places) that unfortunatelly can not be booked or guaranteed so it always depends on actual number of cars parking in the yard.  Don´t be affraid when coming by car to follow the instructions how to get to the hotel; it is located in an area with limited access. We came at 11:30 a.m., our room was ready though and we could check in, which was very pleasant after 12 hours of drive :-).  Staff was very helpful and they all spoke English, breakfast was ok, hotel is in a…

title: Great Value near trains and easy to center
review: The hotel was really close to the train station, but the area does not really have any of the charm that the rest of the city does. It felt like any average city instead of one that the tour books described as the lily of the Renaissance. That being said, it only took about 5-10 minutes to get to the duomo, so it may have been worth it to save some money. The hotel itself was very nice. The lobby was pretty and bright. The room was clean and comfortable.

title: Great place to stay in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Very clean hotel. Staff helpful and friendly
review: Very nicely appointed and clean hotel well worthy of its 4* rating. It was about 3 minutes walk from the station  and very convenient and easy to find. The city centre is about a 10 minute walk but again very easy. The staff were happy to please and the room was large and comfortable with air conditioning.  We would certainly return there and for the money, it was well worth it.  Also, the hotel is offering 25% off 3 night stays on their own website.

title: Ah, Florence in the spring...and a great hotel!
review: We took our baby here.  The staff were helpful and friendly and service was fairly good. Quite near centre of Florence. Lifts were very narrow. Breakfast was nice.

title: Nice Hotel-so/so location
review: Florence was easily the best part of our trip.  And this hotel was perfect.  Just far enough from the center of town, it was easy to find.  Close to the Arno, and only 5-10 minutes to the center, it's a great place.  The staff was great and very helpful.  The restaurant served us an excellent supper.  My wife ate the Bistecca Fiorentina, all by herself.  The waiters were surprised!  The next morning at breakfast, the same waiters offered her another Bistecca Fiorentina, all in good fun!

title: Very nice experience,very charming.
review: I stayed in Venice, Florence and Rome on this trip and this was the best hotel of the three.  It actually had a Queen size bed (rather than two twin pushed together).  Breakfast was very good.  The location was ok.  I would stay a little closer to the city center next time.  It was about a 10 minute walk to the Duomo which wasn't horrible but when you are tired it felt a little longer.  There is a local bar downstairs and to the right of the hotel which looked a little seedy but other than noise there were no issues.  Very close to the train station so that is a plus.  If you are looking for a lesser expensive hotel in Florence than this will probably suit you just fine.    If you watn to see more photos from Florence go to my site www.flickr.com.photos/easygoer

title: A great hotel despite the not totally great location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice clean and convenient hotel!
review: We stayed at the Adriatico for the last 5 nights of April and were very pleased with the hotel itself.  The location isn't great in terms of the surroundings. It's a less attractive part of Florence and seems to be the area for the local African immigrants. They hang around in the streets in the evenings but it's not intimidating at all (as it would be in the UK). They're not noisy and are no trouble. I had to mention that because it has been mentioned before so I thought I would assure people that it's really no problem.  As I said, the location isn't the best. It's basically a side street and away from the main attractions of Florence. However, it is only 2 minutes from the banks of the Arno which is a much nicer area to walk along. It is then a 10 minute walk alongside the…

title: Very clean, large luxury and comfortable room. Magnificent people.
review: Near the train station and the stop for the bus tour, we thought this hotel was very well located.  Few good restaurants around.  Very big room for Italy.  Very nice breakfast.  We were very happy with this hotel and would definitely come back and recommend it.  Staff very helpful asa well.

title: Clean, excellent, good value for money but...not the best location.
review: It's about ten minutes walk from ponte vecchio. The triple room was 45 square metres! The bathroom was large too. The room had no balkony but it was very warm and cozy.  We had a problem about our passports and we had to change the dates of staying. Thanks to Paolo (hotel manager) that was easy. It didn't turn out the same way with hotel Amadeus in Venice and we lost 466 euros. Thank you Paolo we had a wonderful stay!!!

title: Great place if you are taking the train to Florence
review: Stayed for 3 nights over Easter weekend. We found the hotel to be a great all-rounder: professional service, clean rooms and common areas, good breakfast etc.  The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the train station, which was a bonus but we did not enjoy the location too much as the 15 minute walk to the centre involved walking through a bit of a rough area.  It was cheaper than four star hotels in more desirable areas and now we know why! No complaints about the service whatsoever though so would be happy to recommend.

title: Great Hotel with even better resturant
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Not Bad
review: This hotel has a great resturant La Vela. We went there the first day and had the special menue, typical Tuscan food and wine for EUR 28 pp. It was an really nice food experiance. I would recomend everyone to try it out.  We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we are very pleased with our stay. The hotel is situated near the railway station and a short (10 min) walk to the Doumo. The naborhood is a bit ruff but it felt safe to walk the streets at night.

title: Faultless for its hotel category
review: It is a decent location from the main train station, especially if you are traveling into Florence at night from the train. There are restaurants and things in the area (not many), but good ones nearby. Only bad thing was that the beds were super HARD! After a day of sightseeing, was not very comfortable to sleep on, but on the whole the hotel was not tat bad.

title: Good Hotel and Location
review: This hotel turned out to be an excellent choice for its category and price (I paid £190 for 3 nights through Expedia).   The room was comfortable and clean, breakfast was good and service was faultless.   The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the train station, which is convenient for arrival and departure, and about 15 minutes walk from the Duomo.   I would be very happy to stay there again.

title: Florence was great
review: We have just returned from a four day trip to Florence and stayed at the Grand Adriatico for the duration of our stay.  The hotel is located within a 5 minute  walk from Florence's main Railway Station The Santa Maria Novella and is extremly easy to find.  The area around the station and hotel looks a little run down but we felf safe walking around at night .    Rooms were very clean and looked as though they have recently been refurbished, room service was excellent. Reception Staff were very attentive, and requests made to them were delt with very quickly.  We had a room located at the front of the building on the first floor but with the double glazing it was very quite at night.  The hotel offered a good choice of breakfast options but if you like a cooked breakfast to start…

title: We would have stayed longer if the room rate hadn't gone up
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Affordable prices, clean rooms, friendly staff
review: My wife and I stayed at the BW Grand Adriatico Hotel for one night.  We chose it because we could wheel our luggage (albeit over pretty rough stones) to the hotel from the S.M. Novella bus/train station and because the double room rate on that day (Euro 89) was reasonable.  The location is convenient to the train station (about 10 minutes) and the city center, but we moved the next day to a hotel a bit farther east and closer to the action because for some reason, the room tariff doubled at both Best Western hotels in the area.  We asked if there was a convention in town but no one at the Grand Adriatico seemed to know or care why the rates went up.  The charge for Internet (both in the rooms and at the computer station by the reception desk) at the Grand Adriatico seemed high…

title: Great Hotel
review: We were looking for an affordable hotel near the train station in Florence, Italy and decided on the Best Western Grand Hotel Adriatico.  Overall I would say it was better than we were expecting.  The hotel was easy to find (with some help from Google maps), just a few minutes walk from the train station.  The hotel let us check in early (about 10:30am) on a Monday.  There was no porter waiting to snatch up our bags, but that was fine with us.  The hallway was extremely hot, however, the room was comfortable and the electronic thermostat allowed us to turn the heat off while we opened the window.  We did not have a view of anything, but we did not ask (or pay) for it either.  The room was very clean, seemed well maintained, and we never heard a single noise from outside or…

title: Good hotel
review: Great Location,  decent size room. Breakfast was included.  A few blocks for the train station and all major sites.  I would recommend it. Good value

title: Excellent Hotel in a Great Position
review: This is  a very nice 4star hotel in central florence. I chose this hotel for its central location, good reviews and value for money. It didn't dissapoint. Location wise, it is less than 5 min easy walk to main train station SMN and about 5min walk to the Duomo (main central church) and ponte vechio.The hotel has a nice lobby and helpful front desk staff. The room was large with high ceilings and nice timber decor. Flat screen TV was good. The bathroom was large and clean and relatively modern. Breakfast included was very ample with some hot food also. Nice touch was a free welcome drink in the bar on arrival. There is a very nice small trattoria 50metres from the hotel which was popular and served nice typical tuscan food. Problems: not many...the safe in the room did not work…

title: excellent rooms
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Impressed
review: This hotel has very beautiful rooms with new and modern furniture , paintings on the walls , double glass windows and big bathrooms with bathtube . All the hotel is clean even the carpet on the floor is new and clean .      The breakfast is rich and tasty . When we stayed here it was september and we could have our breakfast at the garden in a very relaxing atmosphere.     Staff is very friendly and polite .      The location is ok , close to the trainstation , you can go by feet . The only thing that i didn't like is that the neighborhood was a little strainge with people drinking at the streets and makeing noise .      But i will consider stay here again .

title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
review: We did not book this hotel, but were sent here as our original hotel was under construction. We were given a room on the 6th floor. Were were completely suprised when we opened the window to be able to see the Duomo and Baptistry from our room. It was a very nice.  The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk from the train station. It is in an area with multiple restaurants, some full tourist, and some with lower prices on a set menu.  It was easy to walk everywhere we wanted to go from the hotel. The hotel had multiple elevators, which was nice. The lobby  was large, nice, and had 2 internet terminals. It was about 5 euro for 15 min, which we found pricy. There was an internet place nearby though. It was also near a bread and liquore shop, which we took advantage of.  The room was…

title: Lovely hotel
review: The Grand Hotel Adriatico was an excellent hotel in a great location.  Altough in a little backstreet it was about a 10 minute walk to the centre of Florence either through the streets or along the river - which was lovely.  Our room was fantastic with a huge bathrooom.  The breakfast was really good - loads of choices to suit all needs and tastes. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel had a really grand feel to it.  Florence is a wonderfully cultural city and there was so much to see and do.  Although we queued for 2+ hours to see David it was well worth it (we did however found out after that we could have bought advance tickets throuh our hotel and avoided the queues!).  Palazzo Pitt was absolutely stunning. I spent my birthday there and it was just…

title: Great Hotel
review: The Grand Hotel Adriatico is a very nice hotel! We were Belgian guests, staying there in a three persons room from 13th until 15th August. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very nice and clean! The rooms were also very quiet. We never heard one of the other guests. Breakfast was excellent and extensive. The location of the hotel is very good (in the center of Florence nearby the train station). We can definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Loved Adriatico!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great hotel in convenient but somewhat sketchy location
review: 3 days here before moving onto Siena. Really lovely hotel and staff. Had reasonably equipped buffet breakfast in shaded garden. Room clean and our son had small room adjacent to ours. Hotel restaurant expensive but lunch was lovely. Travelled with Citalia who transfered us to Hotel by taxi from Pisa Airport.  Florence is nice but very expensive and we booked in advance tours of Uffizi and Acedamia which was good as long queues in strong sun and extreme heat. Definately climb 463 steps to Duomo as Dome paintings need to be seen near as are exceptional. Ponte Vechio bridge over rated but if you like gold shops then go for it!  Would recommend hotel!

title: Really Liked the Grand Hotel Adriatico
review: Room was big, clean and modern.  Located close to train station, which is convenient to the centre but also not the best neighbourhood.

title: Good Hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. This hotel is very convenient to the railroad station and not far from the main attractions.   The building itself is not historical or "pretty".  However, it has a really nice interior and the rooms look as if they were very recently renovated.   The decor is the room is Tuscan style and bathrooms are very nice, modern flat screen tv as well.   Air conditioning is great and this came in very handy when we experienced super hot weather.  The Reception was very nice and the breakfast was very good.  The Hotel restaurant ended being great.   We were very impressed with the quality of the food and it ended up being one of favorite meals on our trip.   I would definitely recommend this hotel if traveling by rail and you want modern, clean…

title: definitely recommend
review: This is a very convenient hotel. I stayed with my family for 2 nights (2 Adults + 1 kid). It is very close to main station about 5 minutes walk and also about 10 to 15 minutes walk to all the attractions in Florence. You can take a train to Pisa which runs every 20 minutes from main station. It takes about 1 hour to reach Pisa. Pisa is half a day visit. Hotel is clean, rooms are clean and breakfast is above average. There are couple of convenience stores about 100 feet from hotel to buy groceries etc. Staff is very cooperative and can speak better english. Internet is expensive. However there is any internet cafe is next to the hotel which is less expensive. I strongly recommed this hotel to the tourists visiting with families.

title: Great hotel, good location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Close to Turist Attractions
review: Stay in hotel Adriatico was part of Gate1 tour that happened in Apr 2008. It was a very wise choice on their part - 20 mintes of leisure walk walk to all main sights. A lot of Italians were staying in a hotel as well. If you are not comforable in immigrant block, you might feel unasfe walking at night. But really there is no problem - its a city and you have to live its life. For italians it wasn't a problem - there are a lot of great restaurants, wine bars near the hotel filled by locals. We had one of the best meals just around the corner from our hotel (recommended by british guidebook Lets go Italy) Train and bus station is 7 min walk from a hotel - very convinient for trips outside of Florence. Due to the brand you'll find some amenities Americans are used to, it has more…

title: Reasonable but nothing special.
review: The hotel is located close to lots of attractions. Around the hotel you find that inmigrants from different parts of the world (Colombia, Egipt, etc) gather in different outside cafes. The elevators were small (european standard) the breakfast (included in price) was better than expected. The rooms were acceptable and clean. Reception personnel were helpful always. Internet conection worked properly. No problem getting a cab in 5 minutes (reception personnel got it without problems).

title: Fabulous
review: My wife and I stayed at the Adriatico for five nights in early April. We flew into Pisa airport and travelled by bus from the airport to Florence. The bus drop off, by Florence rail station, was a fairly easy walk of about a six or seven minutes from the hotel.   Not particularly impressed at first. The road was pleasantly busy with lots of bustle and noise, cafes, small shops, car hire places, groups at tables on the pavement, etc......... and then someone tried unsuccessfully to pick my pocket as we towed our cases along the pavement  outside the hotel's main entrance - which happened to be closed off because of building work. However, nothing too disastrous, could happen anywhere we thought as we wandered round to the back entrance.   Reception staff in particular and others…

title: Wonderful
review: A fab place to stay whilst in Florence. Close to the Train Station and to all the sights. If you want to capitalise on your trip find the CAF tour office. We booked a tour every day and got to see Sienna, San Gimingano, Lucca, Pisa, Chianti and did the morning and afternoon tour of Florence - all with CAF tours.  The hotel was warm and cosy, with friendly english speaking staff, Service was second to none particularly from the man behind the bar who spoke english to us and then french then broke into german with another couple, impressive.   The breakfast is great with ample supplies of Fruits, Cereals, Breads, Juices, Fresh Milk, Cold Meats & Cheeses and Fresh milk (not UHT)  Internet access was available in the bed room and also on pay per use computers in the Reception area. …

title: Definitely recommended
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good Hotel poor Location
review: Pleased to see some good reviews have come up since I last looked.  Have recently returned from a week at the Adriatico and found it very good.  Staff helpful and mostly friendly (it's amazing how much good will you get  from trying the most basic Italian - even "buon giorno" is a start -  though everyone we encountered had at least some English).  Room comfortable.  Breakfast good.  Don't expect a lot of local colour in the hotel itself - but the rest of Florence is full of it.  Location near-perfect - did everything on foot and didn't even need a taxi from the station.  Area perfectly OK, though as Londoners we are used to what cities are like, so are not going to be put off by the rather dimly-lit streets or the odd bar with customers spilling on to the pavement.  Hotel…

title: Great place to stay when seeing Florence
review: 1-The hotel had good rooms but smoky 2-The location is far from the center 3-The surroundings are not the best, be careful

title: A great stay in Florence
review: Located a short walk from the FSM train station, this is an excellent place if one is in Florence for the museums and the area.  The room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast just fine, a nice buffet.  Most importantly, the hotel staff was very helpful with directions and information.  My wife had emailed ahead to get tickets to the major museums and those were waiting for us upon arrival, so no waiting in lines at the Academia, etc.  The is a moderately price hotel (we got a great 3-day deal with a 21 day cancellation provision) in  a good area.

title: Hotel safe theft
review: The Grand Hotel Adriatico is a well-located and comfortable place to stay while in Florence.  Just a couple of blocks from the Arno, it is far enough away from the main attractions to be peaceful, but still close to everything you want to stay (especially convenient to the train station).  The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and quiet, and our bathroom was well-appointed. The breakfast was very nice as well. We would definitely stay again!

title: Good location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Reasonable Hotel in Florence, near Main Train Station
review: A four night stay at the Grand Adriatico Hotel which we felt was a pleasant, easy comfortable place to stay with all the usual facilities of a four star city hotel. Bedroom was of a good size as was the bathroom in which were provided the usual range of toiletries. The bed was comfortable, air conditioning controls easy to operate, room safe likewise. Room was serviced regularly with fresh towels and sheets daily. Breakfast had a varied range of items and the breakfast staff were attentive,helpful and responsive to special requests. Reception staff helpful and pleasant. If you are lugging suitcases etc it takes about 6 minutes to walk  to the hotel from the main railway station. Don't even bother taking a taxi as it will take about 20 min ! At first we felt that the area around…

title: Comfortable hotel, good location
review: Booked a two-night stay at the Adriatrico in mid-April 2007 through a travel agent.  The hotel turned out to be fine, although some construction was taking place outside the main entrance.  I think the rating of 3.5 is about right.  Good points:  within walking distance to the train station, Arno river & most major sites, no street noise/quiet room, very comfortable bed and clean modern room, reasonably helpful and pleasant staff.  I may consider another hotel next time in a more central location, due to some dark streets surrounding the hotel.  When we walked out for dinner, some streets near the hotel did not feel as safe & well-lit as other parts of town.

title: Very Comfortable Hotel
review: I was pleasantly suprised by this hotel.  It is in a good location - walking distance to many of the major Florence attractions, a few miles from both the airport and train station, with a friendly staff and a complimentary buffet breakfast (which was actually decent considering the fact that it was free).  The room was somewhat plain but large compared to other European hotels I've stayed at with similar prices, and nicely equipped with a mini-fridge, safe, pants press, etc...  The room itself appeared to have been recently renovated, and I had a great view of the city being on the top floor.  As with the other hotels I stayed in while visiting Italy (both Westin hotels), the air conditioning was not functional this time of year, so the window (no screens) had to be left open…

title: What a Nightmare
review: Stayed 1st week of December, 2 rooms for 2 nights rooms 113 & 115. The bedrooms were very nice and recently decorated. The beds were very comfrotable, and breakfast was quite nice. Would deffinately stay again. Ample local restaurants in the area.

title: If you are lucky get the Adriatico
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace.
