title: Poor Service
review: After 2 weeks of poor and expensive hotels in Italy I finally got a terrific stay at the Adriatico , for a more than reasonable price, mostly if you get it through Best Western page in the net. They have a lovely giardino for your breakfast; excellent air conditioning in the reception and FREE parking inside the hotel. A real hard to find gift , just  a  hundred meters  from downtown

title: Hotel piacevolissimo! (very pleasant hotel!)
review: The hotel boasts a 4 star rating but this is highly overrated. The service of the staff ruined our stay and experience in Florence. They were rude, and as I read here on the site "uncaring". We used the Westin front desk for advice and help and they were utterly gracious and we were not even guest there. Very disappointed in the this hotel. Do not let the name fool you, it is anything but Grand. Bed linnens were shoddy, rayon spread that you would see at a Motel Six. Awful place.

title: Great hotel – comfortable, clean and quiet. Good service. Well located.
review: My friend and me strayed at the Grand Hotel Adriatico for 2 nights and it was a great stay! I'm surprised to read some comments because the staff was very nice and helpfull with us.   Our room was clean, well light and smelt of fresh whitened, it was very quite and extremely comfortable. A great surprise was the parquet, that I found more healthy than the usual carpet and warmer than some tile floors. The bed was one of the best  I have ever slept on, new soft cotton sheets. Good idea the flat screen TV in the mirror, the audio can be heard in the bathroom too!!!   The buffet breakfast included in the price, was good and offered a wide choice of sweet pastries, juices,  yogourts, high quality jam and Twinings teas. The Barman Sergio was extremely friendly and also gave us the…

title: Sweltering room in April and staff who do not care
review: We were very happy with our stay at the Adriatico. Very comfortable bed with fresh, soft, cotton sheets, plush extra blankets in wardrobe. Also, the walls are thick, so the room was very quiet. We had one of their cheaper double rooms too when they were almost booked up, so if this was one of their lesser rooms I'm fairly impressed :-)  I'm baffled by some of the other remarks on here about this hotel!!??  The hotel has obiously been totally renovated recently – our room had that brand new feel and was decorated in a very sophisiticated creams, browns and burnt orange. Lovely wooden floors with 2 rush/leather trimmed mats, and thick full length window dressings. The room had very high ceilings, and a tall window by the dressing table. We had a flat screen tv (had CNN, Sky news…

title: Bad, Bad, Bad
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Comfortable, clean Hotel
review: Where can I start? Had a shoot in Florence and therefore had to organise accommodation  for 8 people, 3 nights. Booked the Rivoli hotel online months ago. Everytime I called they to ask about confirmation,parking,etc they never mentioned any problems. However, when arriving in Florence, the gentleman told me there have been problems with their website and therefore we had to move to the Grand Hotel Adriatico. And there it all started...  The basic mistake - gave us double rooms when we wanted twin ones. All fine, I thought - just need to go downstairs and ask them to change it. And so I did. Imagine my surprise when the gentleman refused to believe me but said: "if you want another one, then take this one". Again, these rooms were double. Eventually, after 30 minutes and after…

title: Nice Hotel
review: We were originally booked to stay at another Best Western Hotel in Florence but due to room problems when we arrived (overbooking I suspect) we were relocated to the Grand Hotel Adriatico.  The hotel is central but not on a busy street so was quite quiet. We found everywhere within walking distance, 2 minutes walk and you are on the banks of the Arno. The bedroom was clean, comfortable with decent shower and bath.  Breakfast buffet was adequate, you had the option to purchase additional items for breakfast but in my opinion there was enough to set you up for the day. The staff we found to be very friendly and helpful and as a result I would not hesitate to stay here again if I was returning to Florence

title: good but not special
review: Spent 3 nights in this well located hotel.You can walk to all the main atractions within 10-15 minutes, including the Piaza Michaelangelio. Room was comfortable but some what basic. Probably not a 4 star but a good 3  star. Breakfast was adequate, main restaurant a bit pricy for what was presented. Over all a hotel that I would recommend and will certainly go back to it.

title: Convenient location / good service / reasonable accomodations
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: A satisfactory (but not a great) experience.
review: Our group stayed here during our trekk across Italy - husband, sisters, brother, aunt and parents.    Everyone was pleased with the hotel.  Sergio at the bar was always good to us.  I wouldn't waste your time with the hotel's restaurants though.  You can find similar in the city center for cheaper.   No one had a problem with their rooms.  Most were decorated as a Best Western in the USA would be except my sister and her boyfriend's - they had old charm furniture.  The rooms were always clean and the bathrooms were good sized.    Hotel was a short walk from the city centre.  Actually, my mom didn't think it was "that close" so that maybe the youth in me.  But really, I would say it was about five city blocks.  And it is within walking distance from the train station.
